events.name: NYU International Hospitality Investment Forum
events.description: Join 2,200+ hospitality visionaries, innovators, & industry leaders at the leading hospitality investment forum, where our 2025 theme "Engagement Drives Returns" explores how strategic stakeholder engagement drives market results. Key stakeholders will gather to shape the future of hospitality real estate. NYU International Hospitality Industry Investment Conference became NYU International Hospitality Investment Forum:This secures NYU IHIF's place within the global IHIF portfolio, representing the US market as a major player within hospitality investment.Attending an IHIF event provides participants with a global outlook combined with regional expertise & opportunities. IHIF events are known for bringing in cross border perspectives, use cases & strategies that can be adopted & applied within local markets.By participating in NYU IHIF you are still supporting future hospitality leaders. as you are financially contributing to the Jonathan M. Tisch Center of Hospitality to help fund student scholarships at the NYU School of Professional Studies (NYU SPS).DATEJune 1 - 3, 2025 TIMECheck agenda for details LOCATIONNew York Marriott Marquis AUDIENCEPublic REGISTRATIONOpen to industry professionals CONTACTNYU Hospitality Conferencehospitality.conf@nyu.edu Register NowFind out moreSponsorsChair & CommitteeVenue & AccommodationContacts & PressWhat to expect this year?Industry Leaders: Hear Jeff T. Blau (Related Companies) share insights on real estate development innovation & Matthew Luzzetti (Deutsche Bank) discuss macro- economic trends in hospitality real estate.Enhanced Networking: Connect with C-suite executives & major investors in our optimized networking spacesExpert Panels: Gain essential insights through two days of intensive strategy sessionsMaking an ImpactYour participation goes beyond networking by directly supporting future hospitality leaders through our Conference's scholarship program. Thanks to our generous community, we've contributed over $2 million to support talented students at the NYU SPS Tisch Center of Hospitality. Your tax-deductible contribution to the Tisch Center Scholarship Fund creates opportunities for diverse students pursuing careers in hospitality. Key Conference TopicsInvestment & Capital MarketsAsset Management & OperationsDevelopment & InnovationMarket Segments & Brand StrategyTechnology & Future TrendsSustainability & Climate ResilienceWho Will Benefit from Attending the NYU IHIF?Architects & DesignersAttorneysBrokersConsultantsDevelopersFranchisorsInvestment BankersInvestorsLendersLodging executivesManagersOwnersOperatorsProduct & service providers to the lodging industry* The conference is not accredited to certify CLE or CPA credits. We can provide a Letter of Attendance which can be submitted to an agency of your choice. Please check the requirements of your agency prior to the conference & note that we do not verify the number of hours or sessions attended. To receive a Letter of Attendance, please send an email to hospitality.conf@nyu.edu.

events.name: NJ Fast Expo
events.description: Join us for our NJ FAST Expo. More details to come! Startups Pitches Listed Below: Squirro turns meaningless data into A.I.-driven actionable Insights. Venteur is an AI-powered benefits marketplace that empowers individuals to take control of their health care. DeepKeep multimodal AI security safeguards machine learning pipelines, promoting secure, unbiased, real time & trustworthy AI solutions. Penelope is a self-service retirement platform for small & micro businesses. Vaultik is the bank for your belongings that unlocks a new world of post sale opportunities including perks, insurance, & credit services for high net worth individuals. Markets EQ provides GenAI solution providing competitive tonal analysis, previously unavailable awareness. Cranium is an AI security & trust platform that delivers security & trust to the AI revolution. Ledge is a command center for payments built for finance teams operating at scale. Column is an AI-powered insurance management platform designed for today's financial professionals. Clarista is a data analytics platform that provides real-time answers from any enterprise platform, acting as a bridge between technical data & AI. OpenVC provides investible unicorn indexes of the most innovative late-stage venture capital companies.  AQ22 is a loan assessment AI solution built exclusively for credit analysts. Our platform boosts loan assessment efficiency, accuracy, & transparency for creditors, credit unions, & alternative lenders.  Indemn builds machine learning-powered insurance conversations. Users can learn about coverage, purchase insurance, & perform service tasks through natural conversation. FinX Capital Markets builds high-performance systems for investors, analysts, & risk managers of capital markets. Kobalt Labs is an AI-powered platform to reduce errors & increase efficiency in manual compliance work. Atidot empowers life insurance & annuity writers to evaluate opportunities in the in-force of business with big data & predictive analytics. Truthifi is a developer of a wealth management platform designed to offer financial advisory services. #NJFAST #Innovation #NextGenStartups #Networking #GameChangers #NewJersey #Startups #Accelerator

events.name: Sky-High Pitch Competition
events.description: A curated & mindful Tech Week gathering for Founders, Builders, & Believers. We're set for an experience like no other-where modern wellness meets cutting-edge tech, & Apollo Society collides with Rocket Mixer to create something extraordinary in one of the most beautiful & serene places in New York - Edge's Outdoor Deck. First off, we are going to start our morning with a guided breathwork session by Apollo Society. That's when we take a moment to relax, recharge our minds & bodies, & enjoy the stunning view of NYC! With focus sharpened, the pitch competition begins. 10 founders will deliver elevator pitches to a panel of top investors. The top three move on to a finale round, where they'll pitch again in more detail & receive deeper feedback.  The winner receives: $2,500 Draper House credit for global stays, programs, or funding opportunities Private Breakfast with top VCs, investors & cultural leaders Mito Health Biomarker Testing ($500 value) for optimized performance Lazo Premium Package: 2-year subscription, free business incorporation, & more Priority Access to future Apollo Society & Rocket Mixer events  Every attendee will receive: Full Othership Signature Experience Pass - Includes guided breathwork, sauna, & ice bath journey - a complete mind-body reset. Wellness Gifts Curated by Apollo Society partners to elevate your self-care ritual. Startup Support from Lazo: 6-month subscription to Lazo One + 50% off tax & bookkeeping services. Networking with Top Founders & Investors Priceless connections designed to inspire, elevate, & expand your journey.  Panel of Top Investors: Nicole Newman Enslein, Loeb.nyc, Sublime Communications Slava Rubin, Indiegogo, Nillion Jenn Bonine, Valhalla Capital Mike Schulte, Loeb.nyc, Great North Ventures Patrick Tsang, Chairman Tsangs Group a16z  Program Schedule 7:00 AM - Guest Check-In7:15 AM - Guided Breathwork Session7:45 AM - Light Snack & Refresh8:00 AM - Pitch Competition Kickoff8:45 AM - Highlights & Winner Announcement9:00 AM - Event Closing - Let's Keep Building!9:30 AM - Private Breakfast with Leading VCs & Investors (place to be announced) Whether you come to pitch your startup, connect with investors, or simply to be among the most intentional minds of the week - this experience is for you. So guys- all the way up! See you at the top-100th floor. Apollo Society & Rocket Mixer Team    Key Info Before You Join  Pitch Competition:To apply, purchase a ticket, & fill out the application form.Note: Due to high volume, not all applicants will be selected, but all ticket holders can attend the event.  Ticket Tiers:Early Bird - $45 (limited until May 20) Discounted access for early movers. General Admission - $75Includes entry to the Edge Observation Deck, guided breathwork, curated networking, & a one-of-a-kind pitch event. Premium - $120All of the above plus access to a private breakfast with investors, VIP guests, & organizers.  Please Note:Tickets are non-refundable unless the event is canceled or significantly rescheduled. The event will be photographed & filmed - by attending, you consent to your image being used for promotional purposes.

events.name: Gam3 On - Chelsea Teste Launch For Soneium
events.description: Gam3 On: Chelsea Testnet Launch for Soneium's Gaming L3  Join us at New York Tech Week, on June 4th, 2-4 PM as we unveil Chelsea, the testnet launch of our groundbreaking Gaming L3 on Soneium. This marks a major milestone for the future of onchain gaming - designed for performance, scale, & seamless developer experience. This exclusive event will be split into two power-packed sessions followed by networking & mingling.  Part 1: Technical Panel (2:00 - 2:30 PM) Diving into Web3 Gaming Infrastructure & Chelsea Testnet Hear from leading builders & researchers on the next evolution of gaming blockchains, & how Chelsea sets the stage for what's next.  Part 2: Investor Panel (2:30 - 3:00 PM) Funding Web3 Gaming: Round 2 A candid discussion with top investors on where capital is flowing, what's changed in gaming VC, & what's now in the spotlight.  Networking (3:00 - 4:00 PM) Meet fellow founders, devs, investors, & ecosystem builders. Drinks, alpha, & Chelsea testnet invites await. discussions about the latest trends in blockchain technology & explore the future of gaming. Every conversation could ignite the next groundbreaking idea-don't miss out on this exclusive opportunity to network. This event is proudly sponsored by a16z & WeWork. We extend our sincere thanks for their generous support. About Blockus Blockus is your all in one platform for Web3 gaming, enabling game studios to build fast, reduce costs & laser focus on gameplay.  Blockus provides seamlessly integrated Wallet-as-a-service account + wallet management, first party NFT marketplace, & fiat + crypto payments.  website | Twitter | LinkedIn About Soneium Soneium, an Ethereum layer-2 developed by Sony Block Solutions Labs, is a versatile general-purpose blockchain platform that aims to evoke emotion, empower creativity, & realize the open internet that transcends boundaries. By transcending cultural differences & bringing together people with diverse values, Soneium reimagines how we interact with the internet, opening up a world of innovative applications that fill the world with emotion. Website | X | Discord | Telegram This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Future Of Agentic Development
events.description: AI agents & developer tools are reshaping how software gets built. As AI-native tooling evolves, developers are moving beyond just writing code - toward orchestrating intelligent agents, prompting natural language workflows, & automating entire tasks. This panel brings together - Erik Nordlander (GP @ Google Ventures)- Clmence Burnichon (Director of Engineering @ Datadog)- Merrill Lutsky (CEO @ Graphite)- Zach Lloyd (CEO @ Warp) to explore the future of agentic development. Spots are limited - so make sure to secure yours early! This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: European Tech Rooftop Social & Pitch
events.description: n the spirit of NY Tech Week, Swissnex, The UK Trade Organization, the Consulate General of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in New York, Digital Irish, ACE Ventures, & La French Tech NY are joining forces to host an evening of insights & connections that spotlight Europe's unique edge in global tech. The event will bring together a dynamic mix of founders, investors, & ecosystem builders to explore why many of Europe's most ambitious startups are committed to maintaining operations on both sides of the Atlantic.  Through startup pitches & a candid panel conversation, we'll dive into what makes the European tech model distinct, how founders are navigating global fragmentation, & why transatlantic presence remains a strategic advantage in today's shifting innovation landscape.

events.name: Buildfest 2025
events.description: Imagine starting a business in high school!!!! On June 4th, join BUILD.org at the BRIC House in Brooklyn to meet the innovators & changemakers of tomorrow & learn about the creative businesses they have started. This unique evening will feature a Shark Tank-like Pitch Competition & a Student Marketplace where you can meet young entrepreneurs from across New York & purchase their products.  Like-minded tech leaders will be on hand to support these remarkable young people.For more information, contact pminetti@build.org BUILD NYC is a nationally recognized college & career readiness nonprofit that uses entrepreneurship to empower middle & high school students from under-resourced neighborhoods & teach them the skills they will need to thrive in the classroom & the 21st-century workforce.

events.name: CMO Series Live 2025
events.description: CMO Series Live Venue: SECOND Floor, 849 6th Ave, NYC Date: 5th June 2025 Conference Timings: 09:00am - 4:45pm Evening entertainment: 4:45pm - late Cost: $750 / 595   In 2024, CMO Series Live brought together over 200 fantastic leaders from legal marketing & professional services at a one-day conference, brought to you by Passle. 2025 will see it return on Thursday, June 5th. The conference includes two streams of content, focusing on case-studies of both marketing strategy & marketing technology, making for a thought-provoking day. There will be plenty of time to network & connect with marketing leaders from across the industry as well as the world's best-in-class technology providers. Attendees are CMOs & Business Development Directors in commercial law firms & strategic advisories, looking to engage in rich, insightful discussions on topics that are shaping the future of professional services marketing. There is also the opportunity to connect with the tech partners who can make plans a reality. Space is limited so early booking is highly recommended.   *Photos & video footage taken at the event may be used for marketing purposes.

events.name: Fashion & Creatives Mixer
events.description: it's time for your favorite mixer: the May edition. Just in time for this year's NYCxDesign festival, we're gathering the founders, makers, & shakers across New York's fashion, design, & tech industries. We want to hear what next big thing you're working on! Let's see what happens when you mix design, manufacturing, & digital product folk in the most competitive city on the east coast. If you're full of ideas & want to find the right people that can manifest them into reality, this is for you. Who knows, you might meet your new co-founder, designer, developer, or bff. The vibe is: TROPICAL RESORT come dressed to slay  There will be photography, just check in with us if you'd prefer not to be captured. Grab a drink or a bite, soak in the views, & enjoy!! Follow the luma calendar to stay in the loop https://lu.ma/icon.newyork -- BIG LOVE to our hosts: ICON New York curates community-driven events across fashion, design, & tech, hosted in creative spaces that reflect the energy & ambition of New York. 99 Yards is a fashion-tech platform that connects designers, models, manufacturers, & students through digital portfolios & real-time collaboration tools. SeedLegals is a one stop platform for the legals you need to get funded & grow your business.

events.name: Shaping The Experiential Economy
events.description: In this era of hyper digitalization, we see a parallel, seemingly paradoxical consumer demand for real-life experiences.  This dichotomy actually makes a lot of sense.  The more our lives move online & our interactions get mediated by machines, the more we miss & crave physical interactions with other humans & the world around us. This is why we are so excited to bring a unique panel of founders building in the experiential economy space to Tech Week to discuss what they are building, current trends, pitfalls & opportunities in the space, & where they see the space going in the next decade.  We will not only discuss trends in direct-to-consumer experiences but also cover how various businesses have excelled in using IRL opportunities for customer activation or employee retention.   We will also discuss what it's like to fundraise in the space.  The night will end with time for networking with others passionate about the IRL Renaissance happening today. PANELISTS: Radha Agrawal: Co-founder & CEO of Daybreaker, the global morning dance, music & wellness movement with a community of half a million people. Radha is also an angel investor in mostly female owned businesses. Justin Bolognino: Pioneer in immersive experiences that fuse technology, design, & human connection. As the founder of META & Unreality, Justin & his team have crafted multi-sensory experiences for Spotify, Google, & Samsung in collaboration with artists like St. Vincent & Skrillex for Coachella & SXSW. Virginia Frischkorn: Founder & CEO of Partytrick, a software platform revolutionizing how experiences are planned, executed, & scaled through smart design & data-driven insights. Prior to Partytrick, Virginia spent 15 years as a luxury events planner & was recognized by Vogue & Martha Stewart Weddings as one of the top 50 planners in the world. If you have any questions for the panelists, please send them in your RSVP & we will try to get to as many as we can at the end of the panel.  Please email shanna@bookkaria.com if you have any questions about the event. Hosted by Karia, a platform that curates & executes elevated guest activities for our partner hotels & resorts.  Offerings include sound bathing, sourdough making, watercolor, mixology, & cacao ceremony under the stars.  Reach out to us inquiry@bookkaria.com. This event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Crowd-Source Your Solns - Brunch For Startup Builders
events.description: Exclusive builder gathering: Strategic brunch meets collective intelligence. Bring your most pressing challenge to a confidential setting where fellow startup founders/operators offer solutions from their own experiences. No pitches or passive networking-just practical problem-solving with peers who understand your journey. The guest list will be curated to maintain high-quality discussions & ensure meaningful solutions. This exclusive brunch, moderated by Diane Choi from Samsung Next, is designed for founders & operators who are actively building. Event Details Date: Sunday June 1, 2025Time: 12:00 PM - 3:00 PMLocation: Manhattan, NYC (RSVP for exact location)Format: Confidential roundtable discussion over brunchThe Concept: Bring Your Challenge Each guest must come prepared with one specific challenge they're actively working to solve. As we progress through brunch, guests will share their challenges & receive targeted solutions from peers who have faced similar obstacles. What Kind of Challenges Should I Bring? We welcome a variety of founder challenges at different stages: Growth Obstacles: Specific bottlenecks preventing you from reaching the next levelStrategic Decisions: Key forks in the road where experienced input would be valuableMarket Positioning: Challenges around market differentiation or target market selectionTeam Building: Hurdles in hiring, structuring, or developing your teamProduct Development: Technical or market fit challenges as you buildCapital Strategy: Fundraising approaches or investor relationship questionsOperational Efficiency: Systems or process challenges scaling your businessThe ideal challenge is specific enough to address in a 5-7 minute discussion that generates actionable solutions. It should be authentic-the thorniest problems often lead to the most valuable exchanges. Who Should Attend Exclusively for startup founders/operators who: Have a specific challenge they're working to solveValue both giving & receiving candid feedback from fellow buildersWhat to Expect Structured problem-solving format-every founder presents one challengeModerated discussion to ensure solutions are practical & diverseConfidential environment where candid sharing is encouragedPremium brunch experience that facilitates meaningful conversationWhy Join In a landscape filled with generic networking events, this gathering stands apart by focusing on practical problem-solving. Connect with peers who understand the unique challenges of building a startup & form relationships based on genuine value exchange. Space is strictly limited to 10-12 founders. Your ticket to entry? A real challenge you're facing & a willingness to help others solve theirs. Bring your challenge, share your expertise, & leave with actionable solutions & meaningful founder connections.

events.name: EU Market Pathways For AI, Climate & Emerging Tech
events.description: Join us on June 5th at Impact Hub New York for a full day of expert-led panels unlocking market entry, funding, & growth opportunities in Europe for AI, Climate, & Emerging Tech. Taking place as part of NY Tech Week, this event will bring together leaders from both sides of the Atlantic for a deep dive:  PANEL 1 - Navigating legal & compliance frameworks in the EU (11 AM)PANEL 2 - Understanding the investment landscape across European innovation hubs (1:30 PM)PANEL 3 - Leveraging soft-landing support through trade & economic development agencies (4 PM) In addition to these panel discussions, participants will get networking opportunities & access to resources, investors, & partners in the EU market. Whether youre just starting to consider European expansion or looking for strategies to scale, this event will give you the insights, connections, & resources you need to succeed across the Atlantic. Co-hosted by the Brooklyn Chamber of Commerce, Impact Hub NY Metropolitan Area, Carter De Luca, & Transatlantic Growth. This event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: NYC Coffee Club - Early-Stage B2B SaaS Founders & Funders
events.description: Calling all early-stage B2B SaaS founders & funders!  I'm Olivia, Partner @ Forum Ventures, & there are few things I like more than coffee & community.  I'm excited to host this coffee meetup & bring together the early-stage ecosystem for Coffee Club - a no-stress way to connect with NYC VCs & founders. Request a spot to join & get access to the location. About the HostsForum Ventures is the leading early-stage fund, accelerator & AI venture studio for B2B SaaS startups. Founded in 2014, we're on a mission to make the B2B SaaS journey easier, more accessible & successful for early-stage founders. From our Studio to Accelerator to Pre-Seed programming, we have the resources & network to help founders navigate the early stages of their founder journey. Forum is investing in 85+ SaaS companies this year. Pitch Us here. Escalon Services provides end-to-end back-office solutions, including accounting, HR, & tax services, designed to support the growth of startups & scaling companies. Our seasoned CFO advisors specialize in financial modeling, strategic planning, & due diligence readiness, helping founders & finance teams navigate fundraising & operational complexities. By managing your back-office needs, we empower you to focus on innovation & growth. B Capital invests globally in extraordinary founders & businesses shaping the future through technology. With more than $8 billion in assets under management & dedicated stage-based funds, the firm focuses on early-stage to late-stage venture growth investments, primarily in the technology, healthcare & climate sectors. Founded in 2015, B Capital has an integrated, global team across nine locations in the U.S. & Asia. The firm's value-add platform, together with the consulting expertise of its strategic partner The Boston Consulting Group, provides entrepreneurs with the tools & resources to scale quickly & efficiently, expand into new markets & build market-leading businesses. For more information, click here.

events.name: Leaddev Meetup
events.description: Get ready for the next LeadDev New York Meetups!  Cant wait until the fall to get your LeadDev New York fix? No need to worry - quarterly LeadDev Meetups are back in New York! Join us for the next event on Monday, June 2nd & enjoy an evening of networking & talks on building effective engineering culture & growing leaders. Drinks & nibbles will be provided on the night, thanks to Datadog! Date: Monday, June 2nd, 2025 Time: 6:00 - 8:30 pm Location: New York Times Building, 620 8th Ave, New York, NY 10018 Spaces are limited - you must RSVP to attend. Attendees must also bring a government-issued ID with a name that matches their Meetup registration to enter the New York Times Building. We hope to see you there! Schedule: 6.00 pm - Arrival, networking & refreshments 6.20 pm - Welcome from host - James Courtois (Senior Director of Engineering Manager, Luminate) 6.30 pm - Strategic Approaches to Deploying LLMs in Your Organization - Katerina Zanos (Senior Machine Learning Engineer, Meta) 6.50 pm - Can AI build our AI strategy for us, too? - A Conversation on AI in Organizational Leadership Patty Delgado (VP Engineering, Vividly) & Meg Adams (Senior Director of Engineering, NYT Cooking) 7.10 pm - Break 7.15 pm - The Devops Engineer who never sleeps: Lessons Building AI Agents @ Datadog - Diamond Bishop (Director of Engineering/AI, Datadog) 7.35 pm - Closing remarks & networking through to close 8.30 pm - Close You can also join our Slack workspace to keep up to date with everything in our New York community. Join the channel #leaddev-nyc or #new-york. If you need further information or have any questions, please send an email to: hello@leaddev.com. Here is a friendly reminder of our Code of Conduct to help protect the safety of our community. Don't forget to share this with your colleagues who may be interested, & keep an eye out for upcoming meetups later this year! And a big thank you to our New York meetup partner Datadog!

Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

Morgan - The largest global bank Sheppard Mullin - The largest law firm NECX - Tech Giant in Japan $20B ARR Minerva University - The hardest university to get into Y Combinator - Pylon, Parsana Ai Treasure Data - Raised $288m, $200m ARR AGI - Pioneer of AI Agents Orbiter Finance - $100m+ net profit within 3 years . Ranked #2 globally in the decentralized bridge field This event is exclusively for founders (including platform owners, publishers, etc.), investors, & enterprise decision-makers. Check-in is required at the door, & only approved guests will be admitted The event is a dynamic 2-hour networking session We kindly ask for your understanding as we carefully review & select attendees, which may result in some applications not being approved. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause & appreciate your patience. NY Techweek, where over 100,000 professionals gather from around the world, we have decided to hold this event at this momentous occasion. We're bringing together an exclusive group of around 150 top-tier founders, spanning from pre-seed to Series D, alongside engaged VCs & angel investors.  VIP Sponsored by cyberFund cyberFund is a founder-led investment firm accelerating the cybereconomy. We allocate capital to the best startups in distributed AI to ensure a healthy transformation to a cybernetic economy that benefits humanity.  80+ VC & Angel Investors Ai, Fintech, Climate Tech, Gaming, Edtech, Proptech, Web3, AR/VR, Cybersecurity, Insurtech, Retailtech, SaaS, B2C, B2B, & Pre-seed to Series D stages 300+ Founders/CEOs 3 Series D companies 2 Series C companies 6 Series B companies 35 Series A companies 15 Pre-Series A companies 106 Seed companies 146 Pre-Seed companies 26 Bootstrap companies 50+ Executives 8 companies featured in Forbes Under 30, 12 Y Combinator alumni 1st MELT event ,  We brought in 1070 registrations from all over the world & carefully selected 300 founders & investors. 10% Series A & above (Founders/C-levels) 35% Seed (Founders/C-levels) 40% Pre-seed (Founders/C-levels) 10% Investors Other 2nd MELT event, We brought in 420 registrations & carefully selected 170 founders & 30 investors. Most of founders had raised at least $1 million, had revenue of $1-$3 million, or had a previous successful exit. 33 Series A & above (Founders/C-levels) 133 Seed (Founders/C-levels) 112 Pre-seed (Founders/C-levels) 58 Investors( Tencent , Netease, Docomo Ventures, other VCs & Angel Investors) Others  About the venueOne of the most iconic rooftop lounges in NYC(We use indoor VIP space)If you know the address but are not approved, you cannot participate in the event. RequirementYou must be over 21, have official ID, & your registration must be approved. This event is a part of #TechWeek - a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem.

events.name: Bedrock Agents Workshop
events.description: Join us for a hands-on introduction to AI Agents, where you will learn to optimize task automation using generative AI. This session will demonstrate how these agents leverage foundation models to interpret complex requests, integrate with your APIs & data, & execute multistep workflows seamlessly.  Key highlights:  Multi-agent Collaboration: Coordinate specialized agents under a supervisor to manage intricate processes. RAG Integration: Provide accurate, data-supported responses through retrieval-augmented generation. Configuration: Build & customize agents efficiently with straightforward instructions.   Discover practical, real-world applications & gain the skills to transform workflows with AI-powered solutions that boost efficiency & elevate user experiences. Together, let us pave the way for intelligent automation.  This event features an interactive workshopplease bring your laptop if you wish to participate in the hands-on segment. Are you prepared to advance your organizations AI capabilities? Mark your calendar for June 9, 2025! High level schedule: 2:45 - 3:00: Arrivals 3:00 - 3:20: Presentation 3:20 - 4:20: Workshop 4:20 - 4:30: Wrap up & Q&A 4:30 - 5:00: Networking Bio: Udaya Jaladi is a Solutions Architect at AWS specializing in FinTech ISV customers. With over 16 years of experience, he has extensive expertise in designing & implementing enterprise applications across Sales, Services, Financial, HR, & Payroll domains. In his current role, he partners with customers to provide strategic guidance on building well-architected, AI-powered solutions on AWS. Udaya has developed deep expertise in Generative AI & helps organizations leverage this transformative technology to drive business innovation & efficiency Important instructions  Event starts at 3:00 pm EST, but please allow at least 15 minutes for security to process registration Please ensure that your meetup profile has your full name. Both first & last name are required & we will not be able to register attendees with just abbreviations or incomplete names. There is an optional networking & Q&A event at the end of the meetup

events.name: Infrastructure In Focus - Postgresql Modernization On Azure
events.description: As businesses strive to deliver seamless digital experiences, the demand for databases that combine speed, resilience, & simplicity has never been higher. Azure Database for PostgreSQL is purpose-built to meet these expectations, offering a fully managed, open-source solution with dynamic scaling, zone-redundant high availability, & advanced performance tuning. Whether you're migrating legacy systems or building new applications, Azure's intelligent automation & enterprise security help you stay ahead of the curve-so you can focus on what matters most: driving business value & delighting your users. Discover with Quadrant Technologies, Microsoft, & AMD how Azure's powerful platform can streamline & secure your PostgreSQL databases, no matter where they run-on-premises, in multi-cloud setups, or at the edge.

events.name: Influence & Advocacy For Engg Leaders
events.description: Join our Engineering Leadership NYC event, in collaboration with LinkedIn, focused on discussing the experiences of women engineering leaders. We're welcoming all engineering leaders to be part of the audience. This event will explore how engineering leaders can expand their impact by fostering relationships, advocating for themselves & others, & driving meaningful change across teams & organizations. The topic will dive deep into: 1. How to foster influence through relationships & trust, cultivating allies & making your voice heard with your team/organization. 2. Advocacy as a leadership tool, examining ways to champion both your own contributions & the success of others, creating space for diverse perspectives. 3. Overcoming challenges unique to underrepresented groups in tech, including navigating implicit biases, breaking through communication barriers, & leading effectively Agenda 6:00 PM - ReceptionCheck into the event, & enjoy food & drinks while networking with other engineering leaders. 6:30 PM - Lightning TalksEngage with two short 15 minute presentations on the event topic by: - Christine Choi - Senior Staff Data Scientist @ LinkedIn- Nitya Shekar - Executive Coach & Founder of Second Wind Group 7:25 PM - Panel Discussion + Live Q&ADeep dive into the topic of the event & direct your live questions to: - Christine Choi - Senior Staff Data Scientist @ LinkedIn- Nitya Shekar - Executive Coach & Founder of Second Wind Group- Yannie Yip - Engineering Manager @ Asana- Jin Zhang - Director of Engineering @ Meta Moderated by: - Siri Kostanyan - Co-organizer @ Engineering Leadership NYC MC'ed by: - Alegria Baquero - Engineering Manager @ Zocdoc 8:10 PM - NetworkingMake new connections & continue the discussion with fellow leaders until 8:30pm. About Engineering Leadership NYC Engineering Leadership NYC is a community for Engineering Managers, Directors, VPs, & Staff+ Engineers working in the software industry. The organization hosts in-person events focused on fostering connections, sharing experiences, & building professional relationships. Through curated topics, panel discussions, & networking opportunities, we provide a space for leaders to navigate the challenges of engineering management & leadership together. About LinkedIn Founded in 2003, LinkedIn connects the world's professionals to make them more productive & successful. With more than 1 billion members worldwide, including executives from every Fortune 500 company, LinkedIn is the world's largest professional network. The company has a diversified business model with revenue coming from Talent Solutions, Marketing Solutions, Sales Solutions & Premium Subscriptions products. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, LinkedIn has offices across the globe. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com. Attendee Confirmation Principles To ensure fairness, relevance of the event, & transparency in our RSVP approval process, we follow these principles when confirming event attendees: 1.  Relevance of BackgroundWe will prioritize applicants with an engineering leadership role & experience that align with the mission of our community and/or are relevant to the topic of the event. 2. Prior Event Attendee PriorityIf space is limited, existing community members who have attended our prior events will be prioritized over new applicants. 3. First-Come, First-ServedOtherwise, RSVPs will generally be confirmed in the order they are received. Thank you for your understanding!

Connect with fellow ONE-OF-A-KIND Gen Z founders for an intimate evening of networking, inspiration, & community during NYC Tech Week 2025 at Kiehl's (brand under L'Oral).  What is GenZtea?GenZtea's Mission: Empowering Gen Z founders, creators, & investors to unlock their full potential through personal branding, community support, & innovative resources. We're building a global network of young builders who are not just invited into the room but are leading it. Event Highlights: Network with fellow Gen Z entrepreneurs & creators Share experiences & insights from Tech Week Discover potential collaborations Enjoy refreshments & special experiences Featured at the Event: Gen Z Marketplace: Sample products from CPG companies  Networking Opportunities: Connect with like-minded founders in the NYC tech ecosystem Want to stay in the loop? events.name: Free Speech - Salon To Save America
events.description: You can say anything in America - right? Until your coworkers see it. Until your friends screenshot it. Until your startup pulls the plug. Join us for an unapologetically off-the-record night about what free speech really means in 2025 - who has it, who's losing it, & who's faking it. No panels. Just a room full of smart people, open bar vibes, & some lines worth crossing. The flow: 8-9 PM: Drinks, connections, casual chaos 9-10 PM: Guided roundtable - personal stories, sharp opinions, maybe a little danger 10-11 PM: More drinks, less restraint, real talk continues You'll leave thinking harder, feeling braver, & probably swapping numbers with someone who disagreed with you. Or agreed too much. 50 spots. No recordings. Come hot.

events.name: From Hype To Habit - Crafting AI Products That Stick
events.description: AI is having its moment, with companies racing to ride the wave. But one question looms: beyond the initial hype, what kind of AI products will truly endure? Join us for a dynamic panel discussion & hear firsthand from product & design leaders on what it takes to create AI experiences that are intuitive, trustworthy, & built to last. Panelists Include: Allen Yang - Founder & CEO @ Liminary Andrea Nguyen - Co-founder & Director of Design @ Koi Studios Eileen Wang - Senior Product Manager @ eBay Michelle Hilzinger - Product Lead @ Notion Moderated by Emily Fishbaine - Senior Design Researcher @ Globant, Adjunct Professor @ New York University Whether you're a founder, product owner, designer, or engineer, this event will help you build AI products that not only capture attention, but earn lasting user trust & engagement. ------- This event is hosted by Koi Studios (koistudios.io) & Brooklyn Product Design (bkproductdesign.com). Venue support by BrainStation (brainstation.io). About the hosts: Koi Studios, a digital product design studio, partners with ambitious teams to design powerful, human-centered products that solve real problems & create a kinder tomorrow. Brooklyn Product Design connects Brooklyn & NYC's product design community together through curiosity & shared learning via speaker talks, social events, & hackathons in a safe space. BrainStation works with industry leaders from the most innovative companies, developing cutting-edge digital education that has empowered more than 100,000 professionals & some of the largest corporations in the world. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com

events.name: AI Community Conference
events.description: Join us at the AI Community Conference in New York for 2 Days of networking, learning, & discussing all things artificial intelligence!  Exciting Announcement: Join Us for a Cutting-Edge AI Community Event in New York City!  Are you ready to dive into the thrilling world of Artificial Intelligence (AI)? Look no further! We're thrilled to invite you to a dynamic & engaging community event focused on AI, set to take place right in the heart of New York City.  Pre-Day Workshop: June 5th, 2025 Time: 10 a.m. EST Venue: Microsoft, Times Square    Main Event: June 6th, 2025 Time: 9 a.m. EST Venue: Microsoft, Times Square  Pre-Day Workshop: Hands-On AI TrainingKickstart your AI experience with an exclusive pre-day workshop designed for professionals, developers, & enthusiasts looking to gain hands-on experience with AI tools & techniques. Led by industry experts, this interactive session will cover:  AI Model Development: Learn how to build & fine-tune AI models. Practical AI Applications: Explore real-world case studies & implementation strategies. Live Demos & Q&A: Engage with experts, ask questions, & get practical insights. At this exclusive gathering, you'll also have the opportunity to explore the latest trends, breakthroughs, & applications in AI technology alongside fellow enthusiasts, experts, & industry leaders. Whether you're a seasoned professional or just beginning your journey in AI, there's something for everyone at this event. Here's a sneak peek of what's in store at the main event: Inspiring Keynote + Speaker Presentations - Gain insights from renowned AI experts as they share their vision for the future of AI & its impact across various industries.  Thought-Provoking Panel Discussions - Engage in discussions on AI ethics, diversity, & the societal implications of AI adoption. Your perspective matters, so join the conversation!  Sponsor Showcases - Discover groundbreaking AI startups & their innovative solutions shaping the future of technology.  Networking Opportunities - Connect with like-minded individuals, forge valuable connections, & expand your professional network within the vibrant AI community of New York City.  Fun & Entertainment - Enjoy live demonstrations, AI-powered activities, & interactive exhibits that promise to entertain & inspire attendees of all ages. Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to immerse yourself in the fascinating world of AI & connect with fellow enthusiasts & experts. Please reserve your spot today & get ready to embark on an unforgettable AI journey with us! Stay tuned for more updates & surprises. We can't wait to welcome you to the AI event of the year in New York City!  Reach out if you would like to sponsor & participate in the conference.

events.name: Artificially Un-Intelligent - Tech Themed Comedy Show
events.description: Leave your jira tickets open, term sheets unfilled, & SaaS unscaled for the best night of tech-themed stand up comedy you didn't know you needed. Artificially Un-Intelligent is the flagship event of Tech Week - where tech & comedy collide. Presented by Puzzle, Vanta, & Ramp. This isn't your typical networking night. We're bringing the energy, the laughs, & the connections to a whole new level with a one-of-a-kind Stand-Up Comedy Show featuring SWE, PM, Founders, & VC comedians seen on Netflix, Tech Roast Show, NPR, Comedy Central, Morning Brew, & more! "Why come?" is the wrong question to ask - let's break it down: - We're taking over Broadway Comedy Club, one of New York City's iconic hotspots, located in the heart of the city. - We're gathering the best founders, builders, & investors - expect high-energy networking with the people shaping the future. - Top comedians who regularly sell out shows across the country will bring the energy (and the laughs). - Zero boring panels - just a great show, real conversations, & meaningful connections. Enough listening. It's time to start talking. Agenda:6:00 - 7:00 PM | Networking, snacks, & drinks 7:00 - 7:15 PM | Welcome remarks from co-hosts7:15 - 8:15 PM | Live stand-up comedy show8:15 - 9:00 PM | After-show connections (the best part) Come for the laughs. events.name: Founder Institute University Night
events.description: Join Founder Institute for University Night, a special panel featuring startup founders from Columbia, Cornell Tech, & NYU who are building real traction through bootstrapping or modest seed funding-what we call "seedstrapping." These rising entrepreneurs will share how they've navigated early challenges, found product-market fit, & gained momentum without massive capital. The discussion will be moderated by Jeremy Kagan of Textbook Ventures, who invests in university-born startups across all three campuses. events.description: Business CasualDrinks & SnacksSoftware shapes the world - & it shapes your business. As software becomes more critical to business strategy, the systems behind it are under pressure & the long-term cost of unsustainable code is mounting.  ABOUT THE EVENTJoin leaders from JPMorgan Chase, the London Stock Exchange Group, a16z, OWASP, & Software Improvement Group (SIG) for an insight-packed session on how sustainable software is becoming a key driver of business resilience, scale, & innovation. You'll hear from technical, strategic, & policy voices on how to:  Define & measure software sustainability in real terms Align C-suite vision with development execution Shift quality left in the development lifecycle Navigate GenAI's long-term impact on software practices Leverage sustainable systems as a competitive & compliance advantage  WHO IS THIS EVENT FOR?Designed for both engineering & business leaders, this session combines real-world insights with strategic foresight - & features key findings from SIG's upcoming State of Software 2025 report, including industry-specific benchmarks.  AGENDA3:00 PM - Arrival & Welcome 3:30 PM - Opening Remarks & 2025 Industry InsightsLuc Brandts, CEO, SIG 3:40 PM - Keynote | Sustainable Software Engineering: From Intention to ExecutionPepijn Senders, Head of Innovation, SIG 4:10 PM - Panel DiscussionSpeakers from LSEG, JPMorgan Chase, a16z, OWASP, & SIG Engineering, business, & policy perspectives on software sustainability 4:30 PM - Audience Q&A 4:45 PM - Snacks, Drinks & Networking Whether you own the roadmap or the revenue, this conversation will reshape how you think about software's role in driving growth.  For more information, visit www.softwareimprovementgroup.com This event is part of #NYTechWeek - a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Uniting For Impact - Tech & AI For US
events.description: UNITING FOR IMPACT: Tech & AI for Public Health #NYTechWeek   CUNY SPH & KPMG US Mobilizing Startups, Government, Funders, & Industry to Solve America's Growing Public Health Crises with Technology & AI-Driven Solutions   UNITING FOR IMPACT is a networking event during NYC Tech Week co-hosted by KPMG US & Firefly Innovations, the nation's leading public health entrepreneurship platform at the top-ranked CUNY Graduate School of Public Health.   Over cocktails & hors d'oeuvres, this gathering convenes leaders across government, capital, industry, & innovation to confront America's escalating public health crises through technology, AI, & startup-driven solutions.   The event will spotlight the powerful partnership between Firefly Innovations & professional services firm KPMG US - an alliance that is driving record growth in the annual CUNY Public Health Innovation Accelerator program while expanding its reach & national impact.    Together, they are accelerating public health innovation to confront America's growing public health crises with bold, scalable solutions.   Join a community committed to building a healthier, more resilient nation - while advancing economic growth & strengthening the public health workforce through tech-driven innovation.   Learn more at Firefly-Innovations.org   This event is a part of #NYTechWeek - a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem.    Learn more at www.tech-week.com

events.name: Tech Mixer
events.description: Join Us for Our Networking Event in NYC Manhattan!We host networking events every two weeks, bringing together startups & investors from diverse industries. This is your chance to connect with leading entrepreneurs, venture capitalists, & like-minded professionals, exchange ideas, & expand your business network. Don't miss the opportunity to pitch your startup, gain valuable insights from industry experts, & secure funding. We look forward to seeing you at our event!  What You Can Achieve at Our Events: Find Investors: Pitchers are included in our exclusive distribution to venture funds, syndicates, & angel investors. Expand Your Network: Build meaningful connections with peers, mentors, & partners. Receive Feedback: Gain expert advice on strategies & growth. Validate Ideas: Test your concepts with professionals & industry leaders. Scale Your Business: Learn strategies for growth & market expansion. Relaxed Atmosphere: Network in a casual cocktail-party setting. Problem-Solving: Collaborate with others to find solutions & exchange ideas.At our events, you'll gain practical tools to tackle these challenges.  Requirements: Must be 21+ Neat appearance Positive attitude A minimum of 1 drink purchased at the bar (alcoholic or non-alcoholic)   Our Partner Venue:To continue hosting events at this space, we kindly ask participants to purchase 1-2 drinks at the bar. Thank you for your support.  Who Will Be There: Venture capital representatives Entrepreneurs Startup founders Marketers Experienced professionals from various industries HR specialists Innovators Investors Accelerator & incubator representatives AI experts from the USA, Europe, Asia, & the UK    Pitch Your Startup:Send your pitch deck to contact.us@startupvalley.club & submit your application!    For Investors:Expand your network, evaluate startups, & access our global database.Complete your application on our website to receive weekly digests & curated lists of startups. Enjoy free access to our events as part of your membership.   Reserve Your Tickets Today!We are also expanding our partner network to provide even more tailored solutions for your projects.Sincerely,  The Startup Valley Teamhttps://startupvalley.club/

events.name: Founder's Guide To Fractional
events.description: Sponsored by: iDelsoft What's a Fractional-and why are founders hiring them? Come for the food & drinks, stay for the insight. This interactive event gives you direct access to top Fractional execs across Product, Marketing, Finance, & more. If you're scaling a startup, this is the high-impact talent you didn't know you needed-until now. Whether you're curious, skeptical, or actively hiring part-time leaders, this event is your crash course in what fractional really means, when it makes sense, & how to make it work for your business. No pitch decks. No fluff. Just smart people & real talk.  Agenda 6:00-6:30pm - Arrival, Drinks & MingleEase in with music, light bites, & good energy.  6:30-6:45pm - Opening RemarksWe'll kick things off with a quick, founder-friendly download:  What a fractional leader is  Why this model is taking off in tech  How to make the most of the next two hours Think of it as your roadmap for navigating the night.  6:45-7:45pm - Rotating Stations: Meet the Fractionals Explore stations by function-Product, Marketing, Finance, People, Strategy, & more. Each station offers:  Real conversations with experienced fractional leaders - your chance to ask the spicy questions (like is fractional really productive?) & debunk the biggest myths  A prompt to guide the convo Move at your own pace or follow suggested rotations.  7:45-8:15pm - Group Reflection & Real TalkWe'll gather for a quick & candid debrief:  Founders: What did you learn or realize tonight?  Fractionals: What misconceptions do people still have?  Open mic for Q&A, insights, & follow-ups  8:15-8:30pm - Closing & Open MingleStick around to swap contacts, take selfies, & keep the conversation going. You never know who you'll meet or what spark will come from it. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com

events.name: Before The Inbox - Founders On Staying Informed Pre-Newsletter Boom
events.description: That time of year has finally arrived-NY Tech Week kicks off today, & we couldn't be more excited to launch our event series alongside one of our beloved partners-Perkins Coie. Everything's set for a vibrant fireside chat on a trending topic, followed by a networking experience like no other. Oh, & come hungry-lunch is on us! Panelists --  Jay Rosen - Professor of journalism at NYU & author of PressThink Siri Cosper - Head of B2B Sales at Morning Brew (4 million of subscribers) Sagnik Basu - Journalist at Fox News, community builder & content creator Marcos Dinnerstein - Creator of A Better Mousetrap, one of the oldest newsletters covering NYC Tech  Event overview- "Long before Substack feeds & curated morning briefs, how did entrepreneurs stay ahead of the curve? This fireside chat brings together seasoned founders & today's leading newsletter creators to explore how information habits have evolved-from cold RSS feeds & forum rabbit holes to the explosion of tech-focused newsletters." Join us! RSVP here   https://lu.ma/ii3gjq2o Rocket Mixer Team

events.name: Building Emotional Support Systems w/ AI
events.description: This isn't just another tech panel-join us for an intimate, women-led roundtable exploring how AI can support emotional wellbeing, digital balance, & addiction recovery in today's high-pressure, hyperconnected world. This gathering will break into small, thoughtfully curated groups to spark honest conversations, not lectures. Together with 50 mission-driven technologists, builders, & community leaders, we'll dive deep into designing a more compassionate digital future.  Core topics we'll explore: How AI can offer non-judgmental, always-on emotional support Rethinking digital wellness & social media through a gender-inclusive lens Exploring voice vs. text agents for crisis care Designing pro-user algorithms that empower attention-not exploit it Our hosts:EchoHer is a non-profit organization dedicated to empowering women & non-binary founders & funders by increasing their representation & success in entrepreneurship. We foster a supportive ecosystem to drive meaningful change & create impactful opportunities through monthly events, co-working opportunities, curated networking sessions, pitch nights, & insightful panel discussions. PowerYou is an AI-powered companion for emotional healing & wellbeing. Designed for people navigating addiction, burnout, or self-doubt, it offers daily support through guided reflection, personalized action plans, & a warm, human-like AI guide named Kris. We imagine a world where no one has to suffer alone in their hardest moments - because the support they need is right in their pocket. Already ready to listen. Always learning. Always there. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

Mark your calendars!  Date: Monday, June 2, 2025 Time: 6:00 PM - 9:30 PM Location: Civic Hall, Union Square, 124 E 14th Street This month's theme is Physical & Embodied AI - exploring how AI takes shape in the real world, from robotics to interactive devices & beyond. We're curating a stellar lineup of demos & presenters, & we'll be announcing the details very soon! Don't miss this chance to see cutting-edge innovations in action & connect with some of the brightest minds in tech & robotics. Secure your spot now & be part of this incredible evening of tech, ideas, & community! #NYTechMeetup #TechWeek #NYRoboticsNetwork #PhysicalAI #EmbodiedAI  June 02, 2025 at 6:00pm - 9:30pm Civic Hall Union Square - 124 E 14th Street @Irving Place $25.00 USD

events.name: Venture Roadtrip
events.description: VENTURE ROADTRIP USA: THE ONLY NYC TECH WEEK EVENT WORTH THE MILEAGE Bored of the same coastal echo chambers? Put your networking GPS on "adventure mode" & merge onto something completely different!  FASTEN YOUR SEATBELTS: WE'RE TAKING THE ROAD LESS VENTURE-D  Daring Ventures invites you to ditch the Silicon Valley traffic jam & join us for a cross-country expedition to the beating heart of America's overlooked tech hubs. No compass necessary-just bring your appetite for disruption & authentic BBQ! WHY STAY IN YOUR LANE when you can swerve into the fast-growing tech scenes beyond the coasts? Our all-star lineup of non-coastal VCs will be your tour guides through the technological landmarks you've been missing: Columbus, OH - Where innovation doesn't require an ocean view Milwaukee, WI - Brewing up startups that'll make you say "cheese!" Atlanta, GA - Where startups rise faster than the summer heat Austin, TX - Where your funding round comes with a side of queso PANELISTS: Christy Johnson (Fireroad Ventures) Jennifer Abele (VC 414) William Leonard (Valor Ventures) Anish Zut (Drive Capital) FUEL UP with a mouthwatering spread of authentic regional delicacies that'll make your typical catered NYC event seem like a sad highway rest stop vending machine. WARNING: Attending other Tech Week events after ours may cause severe withdrawal symptoms. Side effects include constantly mentioning "this amazing founder from Wisconsin" & unconsciously calculating how your funding would stretch 3x further in Kansas City. THE SCENIC ROUTE IS THE ONLY ROUTE: In one night, you'll meet more genuine innovators than in a week of standard NYC elevator pitches. We promise fewer PowerPoints & more powerful connections. DRESS CODE: Highway chic (coastal elite outfits will be politely tolerated) Pack light, but bring plenty of business cards-this is one roadtrip where you'll actually want to pick up hitchhikers. RSVP before we leave you in the dust! SHOUT OUT TO OUR ROADTRIP COMPANIONS Rova Partners Startups often face fragmented financial systems, limited visibility, & the urgent need to become investor-ready. These challenges are compounded by operational complexity & evolving business needs. Rova provides comprehensive support across accounting, strategic finance, & operations. We design & implement reliable systems, establish clear financial processes, & develop investor-ready reporting infrastructure. By connecting finance & operations, we help founders gain financial visibility, improve decision-making, & build a foundation for sustainable growth. From early growth through major transactions, we bring precision & structure to every stage of the journey.   Offit Kurman Offit Kurman is a full-service Am Law 200 firm with more than 280 attorneys providing comprehensive legal counsel across 30+ practice areas. Since its founding in 1987, the firm has served dynamic businesses, individuals, & families-helping them maximize business value & protect personal wealth through innovative, entrepreneurial legal solutions. The firm is distinguished by the quality, breadth & global reach of its legal services & a unique operational structure that encourages a culture of collaboration. For more information, visit https://www.offitkurman.com.  Victor Balladares, a Principal at Offit Kurman, is thrilled to join New York Tech Week as a proud sponsor of the exclusive "NYTW Kickoff & Networking Mixer", bringing together visionary tech founders, influential investors, & industry leaders. With extensive experience advising funds, entrepreneurs, & disruptors navigating complex business & legal challenges, Victor fosters connections that drive innovation forward. At this year's event, Victor proudly sponsors an exclusive gathering uniting leading tech founders & influential venture capitalists, offering unparalleled networking opportunities in an engaging atmosphere filled with interactive displays & immersive technology experiences.

events.name: NYC Hardware Meetup
events.description: NYC Hardware Builders Meetup  Round 2nTo everyone who came to the last meetupthank you! It was a great time, & I loved hearing what everyone had to share. Thats why were doing it again.nThis time, were adding lightning talksshort, sharp, & idea-packed. If youre working on something cool (or learned something the hard way), grab the mic & tell us about it.nnAbout the event:nThe NYC hardware scene is growing fastand it deserves a tight-knit, high-quality community. Thats why I started this meetup: to connect the people actually building real things. Whether you're into embedded systems, wearables, neurotech, robotics, or RF, this is where we meet, share, & push each other forward.nCome meet fellow engineers, inventors, & builders shaping the future of hardware. Whether you're debugging a prototype, bringing up a custom board, or just love the smell of solder in the morningthis is your scene.nBring your projects, your ideas, or just your curiosity. Bonus points if you bring something you built.

events.name: Visions Summit
events.description: About EventVISIONS Summit: NYC - Where Culture, Commerce, & the Future Converge Join us at the Museum of Modern Art for a one-day summit exploring the forces shaping the next era of commerce. Centered on this year's theme-We Are Builders of Worlds- the VISIONS Summit will explore mythmaking, design systems, brand legacy, & narrative strategy. The content is crafted to bring a fresh perspective to the retail & eCommerce landscape, inspiring marketing, CX, & innovation professionals to think beyond best practices & engage in meaningful transformation. Programmed by the editorial team at Future Commerce, this half-day event features a curated mix of keynotes, 1-on-1 interviews, & moderated panels with culture-shaping voices across media, creative arts, brand building, & technology. Through immersive storytelling, unexpected conversations, & cultural insight, this event is where the future gets built. This one-day-only experience will be held in the Roy & Niuta Titus Theater at the Museum of Modern Art, & only 200 guests will have the opportunity to attend. Full agenda & speakers can be viewed at futurecommerce.com/visions

events.name: Building Capitol - AI Startups Political Advocacy Luncheon
events.description: Join AWS Public Policy at New York Tech Week for:Building Capitol: AI Startups Political Advocacy Luncheon  For too long, startups & entrepreneurs have been shut out of the rooms where innovation policy gets made. At AWS, we believe that startups & small businesses are not just key drivers of economic growth-they embody the spirit of American exceptionalism. Your insights, challenges, & experiences should play a defining role in shaping the policies that will determine the future of innovation in the U.S. & beyond. At AWS, we recognize our responsibility to help elevate the voices of startups in these critical discussions. We are committed to working alongside the startups that build on AWS to ensure their perspectives are heard. Through partnerships, direct engagement, & advocacy, we are helping connect startups with policymakers, ensuring that their insights inform the decisions that shape the technology landscape. You'll gain: Insights on the DC tech policy state of play.Strategies for talking to lawmakers to build regulations for startups, by startups.Networking opportunities to connect with industry & AWS public policy leaders.Don't miss this chance to expand your professional network & raise political capital.Registration Information: Due to high demand & limited capacity, submitting a registration does not guarantee entry. All RSVPs will be reviewed & approved on a weekly basis, with confirmation emails being sent to approvals. Agenda 9:00 PM GMT+5:30 Registration & Networking 9:30 PM GMT+5:30 Welcome Remarks 9:45 PM GMT+5:30 Lunch & Roundtable Discussion Topics 11:00 PM GMT+5:30 Open Discussion & Networking

events.name: AI In Action - Driving Real Impact w/ AI
events.description: NY Tech Week | In-Person | Manhattan Ready to move beyond AI experiments & actually make it work for your business? Join Proximity Works for an executive workshop designed for leaders ready to move beyond experimentation & into real-world deployment. This isn't an introduction to AI - it's a hands-on deep dive into implementing AI agents, automation, & GenAI solutions in weeks, not months. Discover how leading companies automated operations, increased output by 10x, & launched AI agents at speed. No buzzwords. Just practical, ROI-focused strategies from the team behind AI deployments at some of the world's biggest companies globally. If you're building the AI roadmap for your company, this is your room. Why Attend? AI Agents in Action: See how companies are using AI agents to automate ops, accelerate workflows, & boost output - at scale. We'll unpack real-world systems that: Reduced manual ops by 80% Increased content output by 10x Went from scope  MVP  scale in weeks, not quarters From Idea to ROI: Learn how to identify high-impact opportunities & move fast - from prototype to production. Cut Through the Noise: Understand what actually works-co-pilots, RAG, model fine-tuning, orchestration-and where to avoid the hype. Battle-Tested Strategies: Walk through real use cases that reduced manual effort by 80% & increased content output 10x. Learn from common pitfalls & uncover additional strategies gleaned from actual deployments. Network Intentionally: Connect with CXOs, founders, & product leaders who are actively investing in AI & innovation. What You'll Walk Away With 1 x AI Strategy Consultation Session with Proximity's AI Experts A clear, customized AI roadmap framework built around measurable ROI Strategic playbooks to launch AI agents across ops, content, CX, & internal workflows Clarity on GenAI, co-pilots, & orchestration tools - & how to fit them into your stack Who Should Attend Founders, CEOs, CTOs, Heads of Product, & Innovation leaders across industries - especially those with $50M-$500M in revenue, mid-to-high digital maturity, & a strong mandate to scale AI with real outcomes. About Proximity Works Born in Silicon Valley, built for real-world scale. We help brands like Disney+, ESPN, & Cars24 build & deploy applied AI-fast. Our embedded AI strike teams combine senior ML engineers, architects, & strategists to deliver MVPs in weeks & enterprise rollouts in months. No fluff, no demos-just execution that moves the needle. We build systems that move KPIs-fast. Workshop Agenda 11:00 AM - 11:15 AM: Welcome Check-in Hello & introductions Snacks & refreshments 11:15 AM - 11:30 AM: Opening Remarks Overview of Proximity Works & the AI Strategy Workshop Walkthrough of the event's theme & agenda 11:30 AM - 12:30 PM: Strategy Workshop 11:30 PM - 1:00 PM: Interactive Q&A Engage with speakers & peers on AI strategies & challenges 1:00 PM - 1:30 PM: Closing Remarks & Networking Summary of key takeaways Final thoughts & next steps Networking opportunity with fellow executives & AI experts Space is limited-register your interest today, & we'll notify you soon if your registration is approved! This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Cereal Founders Breakfast
events.description: Description: Before NYC was the venture capital powerhouse it is today, Kass & Mike Lazerow built, scaled, & exited unicorns in an ecosystem that was still finding its footing. As the co-founders of Buddy Media (acq. by Salesforce for $735M) & serial investors, they've lived through NYC's transformation from an underdog to a global tech hub. Join us for a special journey from scrappy to scaled where we'll learn what it takes to build, exit, & invest in the Next Wave of NYC Tech. Join us for this intimate event that will feature a book signing of their soon to be released new book, "Shoveling $h!t: A Love Story". This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: MetaProp Accelerator Demo Day
events.description: Join us in NYC for MetaProp's 2025 Demo Day on June 17th. Be among the first to meet the next generation of PropTech innovators as the six startups in MetaProp's latest Accelerator cohort take the stage. This exclusive event brings together top investors, industry leaders, & select media to hear firsthand from visionary founders tackling the real estate industry's most pressing challenges. June 17, 20259:00 AM - 12:00 PM ESTMidtown Manhattan (RSVP for address) If you have any questions, please get in touch with Evan Petitt at epetitt@metaprop.com. This marquee event has limited space & fills up fast every year. 2025 Cohort BUILDRFI (Miami) - BuildrFi streamlines financial workflows for construction by offering a clear view of project cash flows & financing options, helping to manage material costs & delayed payments. FRAM ENERGY (NYC) - Fram Energy makes solar deployment for multifamily & single-family rentals profitable & effortless through tenant energy billing software. POPWHEELS (NYC) - PopWheels is revolutionizing urban mobility in America with its e-bike battery swap network, starting with the 80,000+ delivery workers in NYC. PROPRISE (SF) - PropRise is an AI-driven commercial real estate deal sourcing platform, transforming how firms discover & evaluate opportunities. ULAMA (NYC) - Ulama is AI-powered code compliance that automates the approval of construction permit applications. WEALTHIE (NYC) - Wealthie builds more wealth for homeowners by investing home equity in diversified assets without loans or debt.

events.name: A16Z Speedrun - One Last Round
events.description: Join us for an informal mixer during NY Tech Week to meet the partners & operators behind a16z speedrun-our early-stage startup program for founders. We'll be hanging out, answering questions about the program, & giving you a sense of what it's like to work with us. If you've been curious about speedrun, this is a great chance to connect face-to-face & learn more. While our application window technically closes May 11, we're using NY Tech Week to make space for a few last conversations before finalizing the next cohort. Why Attend: Meet the a16z speedrun team in person Get a feel for who you'd be working with Ask questions about the program, what we look for, etc. Share what you're building-we want to hear it Event Type:Mixer Who it's for:Pre-seed & seed-stage founders actively building This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. events.name: Fundraising For Impact & AI Startups
events.description: Join us for Fundraising for Impact Startups, a NY Tech Week event bringing together visionary founders & mission-driven investors. This panel will explore the real-world strategies, challenges, & breakthroughs of raising capital in the impact startup ecosystem.  Hear firsthand from a Stanford founder & an IE Business School founder whove successfully secured funding while staying true to their missions, alongside insights from a leading VC investor focused on high-impact ventures. Whether youre building a purpose-driven company or looking to invest in the next generation of changemakers, this is your chance to connect with a community that values both innovation & impact.  Stick around after the panel for an engaging networking session with fellow founders, VCs, & studentslight catering included. Co-hosted by the IE New York College Venture Capital & Private Equity Club & the Stanford ASES New York City Chapter, lets build the future of impact together. Please note: by registering, you acknowledge that photos & videos may be taken by the event organizers. You also agree to receive email invites & text regarding the event, IE Business School / IE New York College, or Stanford ASES NYC. You can opt out anytime. This event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: A11yNYC - Celebrating 35 Years Of People & Tech
events.description: This event will be online & in-person. The speaker & YouTube live stream starts at 7:30 pm ET. In-person attendees may arrive as early as 7 pm ET. Important note We're gathering in a special location to celebrate 35 years of people & technology. It will be held at Civic Hall at Craig Newmark Auditorium, 2nd Floor, Civic Hall  The Bernard Goldstein Center. 124 East 14th Street, New York, NY 10003. Description We're working on having multiple speakers give lightning talks. Stay tuned! If you'd like to apply to give a lightning talk (5 to 10 minutes), fill out this form. Accessibility The presentation will have human captions [CC], not automatic captions. There will be an ASL interpreter. For Aira Visual Interpreter access for the Blind & Low Vision community, download the Aira Explorer app on the Apple App Store or Google Play. For access in the physical space, the A11yNYC geofence should apply automatically. To access the online webinar for audio description, use the A11yNYC Access Offer to call, or simply inform your Visual Interpreter that you'd like that offer applied when you connect. Please let us know about any other accessibility requirements two weeks before the event. Livestream Link coming soon Provided by Internet Society Accessibility SIG. Location details The Craig Newmark Auditorium is situated on the 2nd floor of Civic Hall. Upon entering the building, please proceed to the elevators, which provide direct access to the 2nd floor. For security purposes, all attendees may be required to check in at the reception desk in the lobby before proceeding. Transportation options Civic Hall is located near several public transportation options:  Subway: 4, 5, 6, L, N, Q, R, W Trains: Union Square Station is approximately 100 feet from the venue. Bus: M14A/D, M1, M2, M3, M55: These bus lines have stops in the vicinity of Union Square, providing easy access to the venue.  Accessibility  Union Square Station is equipped with elevators & is fully accessible. The building entrance at 124 East 14th Street is ADA-compliant, ensuring convenient access for all attendees.  Parking While street parking is limited, there are several parking garages nearby for those who prefer to drive. Ride-sharing services Cabs & ride-sharing services can drop passengers off directly at the building entrance on East 14th Street. Accreditation All A11yNYC meetups are pre-approved for IAAP Continuing Accessibility Education Credits (CAEC). Sponsors Thanks to AKQA, Deque, Evinced, Equal Entry, & Fable for sponsoring. Want to be a sponsor? Contact meryl@equalentry.com

Location details The Craig Newmark Auditorium is situated on the 2nd floor of Civic Hall. Upon entering the building, please proceed to the elevators, which provide direct access to the 2nd floor. For security purposes, all attendees may be required to check in at the reception desk in the lobby before proceeding. Transportation options Civic Hall is located near several public transportation options:  Subway: 4, 5, 6, L, N, Q, R, W Trains: Union Square Station is approximately 100 feet from the venue. Bus: M14A/D, M1, M2, M3, M55: These bus lines have stops in the vicinity of Union Square, providing easy access to the venue.  Accessibility  Union Square Station is equipped with elevators & is fully accessible. The building entrance at 124 East 14th Street is ADA-compliant, ensuring convenient access for all attendees.  Parking While street parking is limited, there are several parking garages nearby for those who prefer to drive. Ride-sharing services Cabs & ride-sharing services can drop passengers off directly at the building entrance on East 14th Street. Accreditation All A11yNYC meetups are pre-approved for IAAP Continuing Accessibility Education Credits (CAEC). Sponsors Thanks to AKQA, Deque, Evinced, Equal Entry, & Fable for sponsoring. Want to be a sponsor? Contact meryl@equalentry.com

events.name: Marketplace Startups
events.description: Tackling the Cold Start Problem is the single biggest challenge facing marketplace founders-how do you build both sides (buyers & sellers) at the same time & keep them coming back? Join us for a raw, no-BS conversation about the good, the bad, & the ugly of launching & scaling two-sided platforms.  What You'll Learn: Real Solutions to the Cold Start Problem : Learn actionable ways to jumpstart supply & demand simultaneously in 2025.  Customer Engagement & Retention: Battle-tested strategies to convert early adopters into loyal, long-term users.  Organic Growth Strategies: Proven tactics to transform early traction into a vibrant, self-sustaining community.  Unfiltered Insights & Hard Lessons: Raw stories about the failures that led to success-no sugar-coating.  Who's on the PanelPanelists: TBD - Founder & Investor lineup to be announced soon. Moderator: Conor Lyden, CEO of TrustapFounder & Chief Executive Officer of Trustap, an award winning Irish Fintech startup with a specific focus on enabling users to buy & sell online with complete peace of mind.  Who Else Is Going Early-stage to mid-stage marketplace founders hungry for growthMarketplace investors scouting the next big thing  Product/tech teams tackling two-sided network challenges  Anyone aiming to build trust, growth, & revenue in a marketplace model  Why You Should Attend Tried-and-True Tactics: Hear exactly how seasoned entrepreneurs overcame the cold start & kept their platform thriving.  A Playbook for 2025: Get strategies that work in today's hyper-competitive landscape-user acquisition, monetization, brand building.  Network with Real Movers: Forge meaningful connections with marketplace experts, potential partners, or even future co-founders.  No-Sugar-Coating Allowed: Ugly Talk is about real stories, real mistakes, & real breakthroughs.  Co-Hosted With: Trustap - an end-to-end transaction solution that seamlessly integrates payments, fulfilment & support into your marketplace or ecommerce store.  GREY Journal - Media partner spotlighting modern entrepreneurs (Apple News + Google News)  About Ugly TalkStarted in 2019, Ugly Talk has been turning business breakdowns into breakthroughs through unfiltered events featuring real-world founders. We've built a community across NYC, Chicago, San Francisco, & Miami - creating thousands of real connections, real lessons, & real results. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.
