events.name: Influence & Advocacy For Engg Leaders
events.description: Join our Engineering Leadership NYC event, in collaboration with LinkedIn, focused on discussing the experiences of women engineering leaders. We're welcoming all engineering leaders to be part of the audience. This event will explore how engineering leaders can expand their impact by fostering relationships, advocating for themselves & others, & driving meaningful change across teams & organizations. The topic will dive deep into: How to foster influence through relationships & trust, cultivating allies & making your voice heard with your team/organization. Advocacy as a leadership tool, examining ways to champion both your own contributions & the success of others, creating space for diverse perspectives. Overcoming challenges unique to underrepresented groups in tech, including navigating implicit biases, breaking through communication barriers, & leading effectively Agenda6:00 PM - Reception Check into the event, & enjoy food & drinks while networking with other engineering leaders. 6:30 PM - Lightning Talks Engage with two short 15 minute presentations on the event topic by: Christine Choi - Senior Staff Data Scientist @ LinkedIn Nitya Shekar - Executive Coach & Founder of Second Wind Group 7:25 PM - Panel Discussion + Live Q&A Deep dive into the topic of the event & direct your live questions to: Christine Choi - Senior Staff Data Scientist @ LinkedIn Nitya Shekar - Executive Coach & Founder of Second Wind Group Yannie Yip - Engineering Manager @ Asana Jin Zhang - Director of Engineering @ Meta Moderated by: Siri Kostanyan - Co-organizer @ Engineering Leadership NYC MC'ed by: Alegria Baquero - Engineering Manager @ Zocdoc 8:10 PM - Networking Make new connections & continue the discussion with fellow leaders until 8:30pm. About Engineering Leadership NYCEngineering Leadership NYC is a community for Engineering Managers, Directors, VPs, & Staff+ Engineers working in the software industry. The organization hosts in-person events focused on fostering connections, sharing experiences, & building professional relationships. Through curated topics, panel discussions, & networking opportunities, we provide a space for leaders to navigate the challenges of engineering management & leadership together. Check out pictures of our events here. About LinkedInFounded in 2003, LinkedIn connects the world's professionals to make them more productive & successful. With more than 1 billion members worldwide, including executives from every Fortune 500 company, LinkedIn is the world's largest professional network. The company has a diversified business model with revenue coming from Talent Solutions, Marketing Solutions, Sales Solutions & Premium Subscriptions products. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, LinkedIn has offices across the globe. Attendee Confirmation PrinciplesTo ensure fairness, relevance of the event, & transparency in our RSVP approval process, we follow these principles when confirming event attendees: Relevance of BackgroundWe will prioritize applicants with an engineering leadership role & experience that align with the mission of our community and/or are relevant to the topic of the event. Prior Event Attendee PriorityIf space is limited, existing community members who have attended our prior events will be prioritized over new applicants. First-Come, First-ServedOtherwise, RSVPs will generally be confirmed in the order they are received. Thank you for your understanding!

events.name: AI Trailblazers Summit
events.description: Join us for the AI Trailblazers Summer Summit 2025, an exclusive gathering of AI innovators & business leaders. Building upon the success of our previous summits, this event will feature a dynamic mix of keynotes, panel discussions, & networking sessions, focusing on the transformative applications of AI across various industries. This year's theme, From Hype to Hands-On: AI in the Real World, will spotlight how industry leaders are moving beyond speculation to real-world impact. Engage with experts from leading global brands as they share insights on AI-driven product innovation, marketing strategies, & risk management. Our past summits have featured senior leaders, both as speakers & guests, from Adobe, Amazon, Axios, Barclays, Bloomberg, Cisco, Citibank, Comcast Ventures, Diageo, Insight Partners, MasterCard, Mondelez International, Morgan Stanley, Nextdoor, PepsiCo, Publicis Groupe, Salesforce, Skadden, The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, Uber, Unilever, the United Nations, & others.

events.name: AI x Finance Happy Hour
events.description: Join V7 & Andrew Yeung for an exclusive AI x Finance Happy Hour, bringing together the boldest minds shaping the future of tech & capital. We're curating a private gathering of 100 Finance Leaders, AI founders, fintech innovators, top investors, & influential voices for cocktails & light bites. Meet fellow leaders pushing the edge & actually implementing AI - hear real stories behind the hype & connect with other early adopters. Capacity is limited & invitations are non-transferable. ABOUT OUR HOSTS:V7 is an AI company headquartered in London with over $50 million raised & 80 strong team. With V7 Go we're building practical agentic automation for high-stakes verticals. Specifically built for teams in document heavy industries - think Financial Services, Insurance & Real Estate - V7 Go is helping companies deploy AI agents that automate intricate workflows like underwriting, due diligence, claims processing, & more. Today, V7 Go is used by some of the world's largest companies in financial services, insurance, healthcare & private markets. Andrew Yeung is the founder of Fibe (a portfolio of events companies including Andrew's Mixers, The Junto Series, & Lumos House). He is also a Partner at Next Wave NYC, a pre-seed/seed fund backed by Flybridge Capital. Andrew's hosted 100+ events for 30k+ tech founders & professionals in 8 cities that were featured in Bloomberg, Business Insider, Fast Company, & Fortune Magazine. Business Insider dubbed him the "Gatsby of Silicon Alley." This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Early Investors Coffee Hour & VC Data Presentation

We'll be featuring a VC data presentation in the middle. 8:30 - 9:20: coffee & "hey good to see yous"9:20 - 9:50: VC data presentation by Harmonic9:50 - 10:30: more coffee & deal flow Serving Joe's Coffee Company cold brews & espressos onsite About Antler VCAntler works with founders through our signature founder residency, adding value immediately, & taking no equity up front. Founders have the opportunity to pitch our Investment Committee to receive a $200k investment for 8%, allowing them to build for 12-18 months rather than attempting to raise before they have real traction. events.name: Venture Salon
events.description: Venture Salon is a private gathering for early-stage & growth-focused founders & investors, thoughtfully hosted by Yorkseed & In Pulse. Designed as a high-signal alternative to traditional networking events, this exclusive evening will welcome 100 handpicked guests - including AI founders, emerging fund managers, researchers, & ecosystem leaders - for a night centered on connection, curation, & conversation. It offers a refined space for candid dialogue, strategic alignment, & meaningful relationship-building among those actively shaping the next wave of innovation. No pitches. No panels. Just curated connections & shared ambition. This edition of Venture Salon takes place during NY Tech Week, bringing together some of the city's most forward-thinking voices for an evening of impactful exchange. Who Should Attend Startup founders (pre-seed to Series A & beyond) Investors: Angels, VCs, LPs, family offices, private equity, accelerators, & corporates Attendance is limited & subject to approval. Our Hosts & PartnersYorkseed Yorkseed is a premier global venture ecosystem connecting visionary founders, strategic investors, & ecosystem leaders. Born from a grassroots community, it now fosters purposeful connections & sustainable growth across diverse tech sectors worldwide. Whether you're building the next breakthrough or backing tomorrow's leaders, Yorkseed is your gateway to meaningful partnerships & transformative opportunities. Subscribe to our weekly mailing list: https://yorkseed.beehiiv.com Join our global hubs: https://yorkseed.co/#about In Pulse In Pulse is a global community of AI leaders & professionals, connecting experts, developers, founders, & investors. We shape future technologies, share expertise, & foster connections to accelerate business growth. From AI engineering to generative art, our ecosystem brings together researchers, scientists, data specialists, creatives, & artists. Engage with AI influencers, thought leaders, & industry pioneers. Whether you're innovating or exploring transformative opportunities, In Pulse is your gateway to meaningful collaboration & the forefront of AI advancement. Subscribe to our community: https://inpulse.events/#subscription Discover more: https://inpulse.events

events.name: Founder & Funder Power Walk
events.description: We are kicking off NY Tech Week with a power walk! Connect with startup founders, funders, developers, & tech professionals while walking, networking, & getting fresh air-all in one power-packed hour! staaake Power Walk: Meet People Without Wasting Time A power walk is a themed social walk where you meet startup founders, funders, developers, & anyone involved in tech-all while getting your steps in. No awkward small talk, just a refreshing break from work & screens. Why a Power Walk is Better Than a Traditional Meetup  Meetups - Slow, awkward, & often a hit or miss. You might leave thinking, Was that really worth my time?  Power Walks - No wasted time. You get fresh air, 6,000 steps, & meaningful conversations-all in just one hour! Even if the group isn't great, you still got your walk in. Dress Code for the Walk to Stand Out  Looking for funding? Wear black. Investor? Wear white or a button-down shirt. Networking? Wear something colorful. Bonus: Join Our Private WhatsApp Group  People who join our walk will be in our exclusive NY Tech Week 2025 WhatsApp group! Free WhatsApp Channel here: https://whatsapp.com/channel/0029Vb9wzfC6BIEg7UVtRq1Y staaake NY Tech Week 2025 Excel List Stand out from thousands of attendees by being on the staaake Excel list. events.name: Expanding Inclusion To Drive Economic  Growth
events.description: Panel & Networking Reception: Tech & Finance's Role in Expanding Inclusion to Drive Economic Growth APCO is organizing a gathering in New York City on June 3! In this panel, representatives from the technology, financial, & public policy sectors will explore the critical role of major technology companies & leading financial institutions in bridging the digital & financial literacy divide, particularly in emerging economies. Confirmed panelists include: Graham Macmillan, President, Visa Foundation Amee Parbhoo, Managing Partner, Accion Venture Lab, Accion Andrew Rasiej, Founder, Civic Hall @ Union Square; Chairman of the Board, NY Tech Alliance Rebekah Tweed, Executive Director, All Tech Is Human The discussion will highlight how these efforts benefit local communities, drive economic growth, & connect more consumers, entrepreneurs, & SMEs to the digital economy. By addressing key initiatives, barriers, & opportunities, we will demonstrate that "doing good" benefits the entire ecosystem by fueling financial growth. Please join APCO for an engaging discussion! **Light bites & drinks will be available.**  ### APCO is a global advisory & advocacy firm helping clients navigate a complex world & create lasting impact. As trusted & strategic advisers, consultants & creators to some of the world's leading corporations, foundations & governments, we discover & foster valuable connections, insights & solutions that drive our clients' missions & objectives forward. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com

events.name: Demos & Dim Sum
events.description: A Technical Show & Tell for AI Builders Technical AI builders only: Science fair meets dim sum during NY Tech Week. Share your foundation model experiments in a collegial setting where everyone brings working code to demo. Connect with peers actively building LLMs while enjoying a traditional dim sum experience. No pitches or business networking-just practitioners showing real technical work. Space limited to maintain our high technical standards & ensure meaningful conversations. Event Details Date: During NYC Tech WeekTime: 12:00 PM (Noon)Location: Chinatown NYC (RSVP for location)Format: Interactive show & tell over dim sum cart service.The Concept: Bring Your Build Every builder must bring their laptop with something to demo-whether it's a new feature, a technical challenge you're solving, or a breakthrough your team just achieved. As the dim sum carts circle, you'll share your work with peers in an informal, science-fair style format. What Kind of Projects Should I Bring? We welcome a variety of projects at different stages: Works in Progress: Technical challenges you're actively solving that could benefit from other builders' insightsRecent Breakthroughs: New features or capabilities your team has just implementedTechnical Experiments: Side projects or experiments that demonstrate innovative approachesBehind-the-Scenes Tools: Internal tools or infrastructure that power your productIntegration Challenges: Interesting solutions to integration problems between systems or APIsAI Model Implementations: Novel implementations or fine-tuning approaches you've developedThe ideal demo is something you can show in 3-5 minutes that sparks technical conversation. It doesn't need to be polished-authentic technical challenges often lead to the most valuable discussions. Who Should Attend Exclusively for builders who: Are hands-on with their product & technologyHave something tangible to demonstrate (no slideware)Value giving & receiving technical feedback from fellow buildersWhat to Expect Interactive showcase format-every builder brings a demo, something to tinker onCasual table rotation to see what others are buildingMonitors available at each table for easier demonstrationsAuthentic dim sum dining experience with traditional cart serviceWhy Join In a sea of networking events during Tech Week, this gathering stands apart by focusing on what builders are actually building. Connect with peers who understand both the technical & business challenges you face, & form relationships based on genuine interest in each other's innovations. Space is strictly limited to 30-35. Your ticket to entry? Your laptop & something to share. Bring your build, share your challenges, & leave with meaningful connections to fellow technical builders.

events.name: Wollen Music Sessions
events.description: Were taking over a hidden rooftop to throw a party above the citystarting mellow as the sun sets, & turning up as the night kicks in. A stacked lineup of DJs will be on deck, serving beats from golden hour to dance floor. This isnt a networking event. Its a sunset-to-night rooftop session with good people, flowing drinks, & zero agenda. Our headliner DJ is Jacob Pace: an entrepreneur & artist who built & exited Flighthouse (one of the fastest-growing media channels on TikTok) at 22. Was named Forbes 30 Under 30 & Rolling Stones Future 25. Secret location drops the morning of. Capacity is tightRSVP now.  Secret Rooftop June 3rd DJ Lineup + Skyline Views   Wollen Labs deploys in-house or managed AI engineering teams to help you build & scale AI-native. events.name: SaaS Founders & Investors Happy Hour
events.description: NachoNacho - The B2B SaaS & AI + Services Marketplace, ZenDesk for Startups, Deel, Morrison Foerster, & Plug & Play are hosting this exclusive Founder + Investor happy hour event alongside key high-profile brands & VC firms. This networking event will be exclusively for SaaS & AI Founders (minimum $1MLN raised), C-Suites, investors, tech media, & tech leaders (partnership leaders are definitely welcome, too). This event will include sponsored drinks & include a rooftop deck component. This is the premier networking event for New York Tech Week.  At New York Tech Week last year, we had an amazing turnout with hundreds of participating investors & Founders. You can see photos from our New York Tech Week event here (https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7204146057440628738) to get an idea of what it was like. We've also done regular networking events for Founders in the New York City area.  We want everyone to have genuine conversations & build real connections here where founders can share their vision, investors can find the next great startup investment opportunity, & media members can get an inside track of the latest deals & tech trends. Thanks to our sponsors! Deel: Deel is an HR software that allows businesses to easily expand their workforce globally. With Deel, you can start hiring employees & contractors abroad while they take all the liability & handle compliance matters for you. Learn more at https://nachonacho.com/product/deel Zendesk for Startups: Zendesk helps startups build better customer service through interactions powered by advanced AI, enabling founders to scale before growing headcount. The best part? You'll get six months free, & its super easy to set up in no time. Learn more at https://nachonacho.com/product/deal-zendesk. MoFo: 170+ ECVC lawyers across 18 global offices advising 2,000+ startups, VCs, & tech-focused clients. We offer full-service supportfrom formation to financings, M&A, & IPOstailored to market conditions. We deliver strategic, end-to-end counsel to help emerging companies grow & succeed. Learn more at http://mofo.com. Plug & Play: The ultimate innovation platform. Our mission is to build the world's leading innovation platform & make innovation open to anyone, anywhere. We do this by connecting entrepreneurs, corporations, & investors worldwide.Learn more at https://www.plugandplaytechcenter.com. Supermomos:Join 20,000+ other tech, business, & finance professionals in NYC by being a part of the Supermomos community. Supermomos is a tech start-up that facilitates curated in-person communities & brings together like-minded professionals to make friends & exchange ideas. The Knowledge Shop: Thefounder community in New York. We prioritiserelationship building over superficial small talk - by bringing folks together at in-person events, & between times, encouraging conversations on our approval-only WhatsApp group. Learn more at https://www.theknowledge.shop. If you're interested in sponsoring, please reach out to andy@nachonacho.com. This event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com. By attending this event, you agree to receive a one-time marketing email or text from NachoNacho & its partners with information related to the event & exclusive offers.

events.name: Petrov Day
events.description: "Wherever you are, whatever you're doing, take a minute to not destroy the world." https://www.lesswrong.com/posts/QtyKq4BDyuJ3tysoK/9-26-is-petrov-day https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Man_Who_Saved_the_World Ways to celebrate: * Screening of the film "The Man Who Saved The World"? (It's pretty good!) * X-risk discussion meetup? * Call your representatives to express your views on any upcoming nuclear risk-related bills?

events.name: World Longevity Day
events.description:
These nice people keep track of Longevity Day celebrations around the world:

http://www.longevityhistory.com/longevity-day-and-longevity-month/

...but while people are living longer every year, there haven't been more Longevity Day celebrations every year. If that seems "off" to you, why not host one yourself? And then tell the folks at LongevityHistory.com!

The website has records of past events, which may offer ideas for how to celebrate. If you have any cool ideas of your own, let us know: alexrk@effectivealtruism.nyc

venue.address: Worldwide!

events.name: World Vegetarian Day
events.description:
"To promote the joy, compassion and life-enhancing possibilities of vegetarianism."


https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Vegetarian_Day


Also the beginning of Vegetarian Awareness Month -- though it's never a bad time to be aware of the vegetarians around you!

venue.address: Worldwide!

events.name: World Vegan Day
events.description:
The perfect day to eat all of your Halloween candy! (No milk chocolate, though.)

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Vegan_Day

venue.address: Worldwide!

events.name: Happy birthday, Giving What We Can!
events.description: Giving What We Can was officially founded on November 14th, 2009. Every anniversary represents a few hundred more people (and in the future, perhaps even larger numbers) who have committed a substantial fraction of their income to helping others effectively. Huzzah!

events.name: Smallpox Eradication Day
events.description:
http://effective-altruism.com/ea/1t5/500_million_but_not_a_single_one_more/


500 million people died, but we turned "Smallpox is" into "Smallpox was". This is one of our species' greatest victories over suffering; it's a good time to celebrate and to remember.
.

events.name: Derek Parfit's Birthday!
events.description:
Derek Parfit was perhaps the greatest moral philosopher of the 20th century, in how he shaped the discipline and raised important new questions. 

He gave us the Repugnant Conclusion and the Hitchhiker's Dilemma, and put a plug for giving 10% into On What Matters, his masterpiece. Had he lived long enough to finish another volume, he had plans to discuss existential risk and dive deeper into questions of how we ought to act.

How to celebrate Parfit's life and work? You could discuss population ethics, philosophize about something else, or consider, as a group, ways to make your lives slightly more rational. (Or just eat cake and sing Happy Birthday and engage in idle, friendly conversation; Parfit surely wouldn't object.)

events.name: John Snow's Birthday!
events.description:
No, not the George R. R. Martin one. The one who helped found epidemiology!

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Snow


Celebrate today by drinking clean water!

events.name: Norman Borlaug's Birthday!
events.description:
How can you celebrate an agronomist who fed billions?

...we're not sure yet, but maybe you can make something tasty with GMO wheat flour?

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norman_Borlaug

events.name: World Health Day
events.description:
Some say that April is the cruelest month. The WHO begs to differ:

http://www.who.int/campaigns/world-health-day/2018/en/

Speaking of April, keep an eye out for World Malaria Day and World Immunization Week later this month.

events.name: World Immunization Week
events.description:
No matter what year you read this, it's probably the healthiest year in human history. Let's celebrate, and keep the streak going!
http://www.who.int/campaigns/immunization-week/2018/en/

events.name: Work in Progress Annual Showcase: Echoes
events.description:
​Work in Progress NYC’s third annual showcase invites attendees to engage with works spanning a variety of mediums – poetry, painting, ceramics, music, dance, video, sculpture, print, and more – that explore resonance, memory, and connection across time and space.

​Food & beverages will be available for purchase.

​Schedule

​Doors Open - 4:30pm
Gallery Start - 5:00pm
Performances - 7:00pm

​
What is Work in Progress?

​Work In Progress NYC is a monthly series where interdisciplinary creatives share projects they’re working on for feedback and dialogue. It’s a safe and conscious space focused on being raw and vulnerable with whatever stage of creation people are at instead of focused on presenting a finished and polished project. Our larger showcases like this one serve as a space to share more polished projects, celebrate each other's work, and give our artists an opportunity to share their art with a wider audience.

​Price and Accessibility commitment

​We want all our events to be accessible to everyone regardless of background or financial status. The pricing shown here is just to help us break even with costs of hosting the event and we don't make any profit off of these. If you have difficulties paying for the event, reach out to us @workinprogressnyc and we can arrange entry passes for you.

events.description:
Full details: https://davidshimel.notion.site/EDM-Production-101-Telos-Haus-Spring-2025-1c9cbe9e47b780379e9beb82f78f0a82


📋 APPLY HERE! → https://forms.gle/1qVxzcLxhaZQExpbA

events.description:
Get up-to-date information at: https://lu.ma/8y5pmnok

Address:
telos.haus
Kings County, New York
United States

Join us for a day of cinema, culture, and conversation. Three vibrant organizations—Viet Creative Society, Taiwanese American Professionals (TAP), and Fuzhou America—have curated an entire afternoon showcasing the richness of Asian storytelling through film and dialogue.
More than just a screening, this is a glimpse into the voices of Asian filmmakers, a celebration of heritage, and a rare chance to connect with artists and communities over shared stories.
From intimate narratives to visionary experimental films, these artists explore identity, heritage, and the modern diaspora with striking…

Hosted by Sonny Tieu & telos.haus

events.name: Beginner Crochet Class: Flower Making **MASKS ON**
events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/beginner-crochet-class-flower-making-masks-on-tickets-1373594150079

Learn the basics of crochet, by making two kinds of flowers, and leave with your own handmade earrings or key chain. All materials included.This is a masks required class. Please stay home if you are sick to prioritize the needs of the our immune compromised community.

The class:
I will teach you how to crochet at a beginner level in general along with the techniques you will need to create two different flowers - a daisy and a forget-me-not! Once you are done with both, we will move on to adding metals and using supplies to either make a keychain or make a second copy and a pair of earrings!Before starting the flowers, you will choose whether you want to make earrings or a chain or keychain with your flower, and based on that, I'll help you choose a good hook size to use for your design. If you want to bring your own hooks to use, that's great too. We will be using green, yellow, white, and blue yarn that we will provide and your ticket purchase will include.
I'm going to go step by step and will be happy to correct your hands, hook, or yarn techniques in person almost like a yoga instructor as I teach you the fundamentals. We will go through how to chain, single crochet, double crochet, slip stitch, weave in ends, and how I use the techniques for my crochet earring business where I sell similar products! Once we practice and go through these fundamentals, I'll apply the techniques for the flower with you following the pattern.I'll be showing you and walking through what the instructions mean and how it looks in real time! I'll teach you how to finish both flowers along with how to weave in the ends of the yarn like I do for my own earrings. Then we will select which metals you need from the Resistor's supplies and I'll help you use pliers to attach the metals to the flowers and the keychain circle or earring hooks. If you want to make another copy of one of the earrings to have a matching pair, there will also be time for that if you want to stay longer with me to help you through it a second time.

Who is this class for:
This class is good for someone who has never crocheted before, someone starting out, a beginner, or someone with a little experience who wants to learn to make the flowers and get some spring accessories out of a refresher class, or someone who is more experienced than that but still would benefit from a class on how to crochet some flowers and make earrings or a keychain out of them.
Please reach out for a pay-what-you-can/free ticket if you are unable to purchase a ticket due to a financial barrier. We will have a few need-based spots available if you email classes@nycresistor.comThe Instructor:I have been crocheting for many years now, and I am now a small business seller of crochet earrings- on Etsy and on display @ theNonbinarianBike bookstore. I have made hundreds of crochet flowers and designed some of my own for various projects, and love it dearly.Crocheting has been so much better than I could have guessed for my creative self. It got me through grad school and an unpaid internship, and so many trainings without losing my mind. It is one of my favorite ways to stim as a Neurodivergent while working towards a project. I have a background in mental health and a lot of experience teaching/explaining things/webinar presenting/etc., and I love learning and helping folks gain access to creative therapeutic resources like crafting and crochet.
Please sign up early, as we need 5 students enrolled to run the class.
We are a proactively inclusive space, and prioritize creating opportunities for the whole community to engage with our events, across all identities of race, creed, ethnicity, age, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, physical appearance, and ability; please read our Code of Conduct to familiarize yourself with our community's values before attending. We are also an 18+ space, and accessibility information can be found here.

events.name: Machine Embroidery with Ink/Stitch – Hands-On Workshop!
events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/machine-embroidery-with-inkstitch-hands-on-workshop-tickets-1374460310789

Learn to create stunning embroidery designs using Inkscape + Ink/Stitch!This workshop is perfect for beginners and hobbyists looking to dive into machine embroidery using Ink/Stitch (InkEmbroidery)—a free and powerful extension for Inkscape. You’ll learn how to design, digitize, and stitch your own patterns with confidence!

What You’ll Learn:
Setting up Ink/Stitch (InkEmbroidery) in Inkscape
Creating and digitizing embroidery designs
Understanding stitch types, paths, and settings
Exporting files for embroidery machines
Hands-on practice with real embroidery stitching!

What to Bring:
A laptop (Windows or Linux preferred)
If you don’t have a laptop, no worries! We have a limited number available for use.
This workshop will be taught be Resistor member Karen.
This is a masks optional event.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/.
Please note that refunds must be requested 24 hours in advance. If you have any questions, please email classes@nycresistor.com.

events.name: Learn to Use a Laser Cutter to Cut and Etch Your Own Designs
events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/learn-to-use-a-laser-cutter-to-cut-and-etch-your-own-designs-tickets-1369929027599

Harness the power of an Epilog 60 Watt Laser! In this class you'll learn everything you need.Harness the power of an Epilog 60 Watt Laser! In this class you'll learn everything you need to know to make the ideas in your head become a reality with a laser.
In this three hour class, you will learn:
How to set up a file for cutting on the laser cutter in Inkscape or Adobe Illustrator.Laser cutter safety including materials testing.Laser cutter operation including configuration, cuts and raster etching in common materials like wood, acrylic, cardboard and others.At the end of class, you will go home with:
One laser cut project, either the class default or a simple one of your own design (see below for details)Resistor Laser Certification, enabling you to use our laser on Craft Nights.Please bring the following to class:
A laptop with either Inkscape (free: download here: https://inkscape.org/release/inkscape-1.2.1/) or Adobe Illustrator installed.
A USB jump drive
The following items are optional if you'd like to try cutting a simple custom design. If your file ends up being too complicated, we may have you do the class default project first, just to learn the laser in the time allotted - but we'll definitely help you with your more complex cut at a free Craft Night in future!
An SVG vector file of a simple shape you'd like to cut for your first cut.A piece of 1/8 inch or thinner wood, acrylic or cardboard you'd like to cut. If you can't bring your own material, small pieces will be made available, or larger pieces for purchase on site.Please be on time for the start of class! If you're late you will miss your slot.
This class will be taught by NYC Resistor member Katie. As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/.
Please note that refunds must be requested 72 hours in advance. If you have any questions, please email classes@nycresistor.com.

events.name: Delete Your Account: How to ditch X and Elon with Cyd
events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/delete-your-account-how-to-ditch-x-and-elon-with-cyd-tickets-1344394272459

Twitter was never good. X is worse. We'll show you how to archive your tweets with Cyd, then delete your content from Elon's website.Remember Twitter, aka the Hellsite? It was terrible, but at least it wasn't owned by a dude who likes making "roman salutes." After you divest from your SpaceX stock and sell your Tesla, come on down to NYC Resistor, where we'll show you how to ditch X but keep a personal copy of your favorite posts using Cyd.
Before the workshop: Make sure you can log on to X on your laptop (not your phone, your laptop) and once logged in, request an archive of your tweets using these instructions: https://help.x.com/en/managing-your-account/how-to-download-your-x-archive. Please do this step at least a week before the workshop, as it may take X a few to several days to process the archive request.BONUS: We'll also help you sign up for Mastodon, an X alternative, if you want.
This event is donate what-you-wish.
This is a masks optional event.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/.

events.name: Intro to Soldering Workshop: Make an LED Tile
events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/intro-to-soldering-workshop-make-an-led-tile-tickets-1369929639429

Soldering is one of the most important skills you'll need for working with electronics. Come join us for an introductory through-hole solderSoldering is one of the most important skills you'll need for working with electronics. Come join us for an introductory through-hole soldering workshop. Soldering enables you to create sturdy connections between electrical components. In this hands-on workshop, you'll learn how to use a soldering iron safely and effectively, and get plenty of practice with both soldering and de-soldering techniques. We'll be soldering up some Game of Life kits - LED tiles that generate nifty animations. No previous experience is required, making this introductory workshop a great choice for anyone who's curious about getting started with hardware tinkering! All materials will be provided.
OK, awesome, I want to join!
Please be ready to start at 1pm! We find that you will need this time to get through the whole class. Our classes tend to sell out about a week in advance so if you're interested, you may want to sign up early.
This class will be taught by Resistor member Raphael.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/. Please note that refunds must be requested 72 hours in advance. If you have any questions, please email classes@nycresistor.com.

events.name: Meal Prep 101: Mapo Tofu!
events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/meal-prep-101-mapo-tofu-tickets-1388914704269

Hey there! Join us for Meal Prep 101: Mapo Tofu where we'll be trying out new recipes and techniques for easy, delicious meal prepping!Meal Prep 101: Mapo Tofu
Date: June 21, 2025
Time: 5PM EST
Location: NYC Resistor
Join the Discussion/What do You Want To Cook: https://discord.gg/NtdYJrjk
Welcome to Meal Prep 101: Mapo Tofu! The thesis of this series is to teach and practice basic knife skills, increase comfortability in the kitchen, and develop knowledge of flavor combinations, portion-size, produce selection, and active refrigerator inventory to better feed oneself with healthy, delicious, and affordable meals.
Each class will take home between 3 and 8 portions of pre-prepared, or low-effort meals along with spice blends, marinates, and other kitchen essentials to make cooking easier and better at home.
Meals will center around vegetables. Groceries will be PROVIDED with RSVP.
Please discuss for other dietary restrictions or allergies before attending. We will do our best to accommodate.
Menu:
Mapo TofuString BeansGinger RicePicked RadishTBDMasks optional
Paypal/Zelle is under phone number 631 371 1168 (Tix 85$)
Venmo is @winston-chiang
Instagram is @ouroboros.in.reverse

events.name: NYCResistor Ham Radio Club
events.description:
Vaccination Proof + Mask + RSVP Required
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/nycresistor-ham-radio-club-tickets-1113096554759

Monthly Amateur Radio club meeting of NYCResistorRadio curious? Join the NYC Resistor Ham Radio Club (call sign N2YCR) for our open and regular meetings, the 4th Wednesday of each month from 8:00 – 9:30 pm at NYC Resistor (87 3rd Avenue, 4th Floor).
The amateur radio hobby has something for everyone, from Morse code to modern digital modes. Bring projects you're working on, gear to fix, problems that puzzle you, outings you'd like to organize, or just yourself to meet & greet your friendly local hams. Drop by the #n2ycr channel in Discord any time to say hi.
You do not need to be a member of Resistor to be a member of the club, nor do you need to be a licensed amateur radio operator (though of course we hope you'll become licensed with our help).
We aim to create an inclusive, encouraging, and diverse environment to bring together Brooklyn's radio hackers, antenna experimenters, shortwave listeners, toroid winders, satellite chasers, and balloon launchers.
Come make some noise in the weird and wonderful medium of radio!This is a masks optional event.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/.
Please note that refunds must be requested 24 hours in advance. If you have any questions, please email classes@nycresistor.com.

events.name: Synthesizer Night @ NYC Resistor
events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/synthesizer-night-nyc-resistor-tickets-1374984639069

Gathering musicians, enthusiasts, and curious minds to connect, collaborate, and share their passion for synthesis. BYO synth encouraged!Join us at NYC Resistor, a makerspace in Brooklyn for an electrifying Synthesizer Night! Get ready to unleash your creativity, explore sonic landscapes, and connect with fellow synth enthusiasts in an evening dedicated to the mesmerizing world of synthesizers. This is a pay-what-you-wish event (recommended donation $8).
Synthesizer Night at NYC Resistor is a celebration of all things synthesizer. Whether you're a seasoned musician, an avid collector, or simply fascinated by the possibilities of electronic sound, this event offers a unique opportunity to gather with like-minded individuals and revel in the captivating soundscape of synthesizers.
At Synthesizer Night, participants are encouraged to bring their own synthesizers, from vintage analog gems to cutting-edge modular wonders. It's a chance to showcase your personal setup, experiment with new equipment, and dive into the rich sonic tapestry that synthesizers offer.
For those looking to enhance the collaborative experience, consider arriving early to connect your synthesizer to a MIDI/CV clock. This allows for synchronized timing among all instruments, creating a seamless musical fusion during impromptu jam sessions.
In addition to the collaborative jam sessions, the event provides a unique opportunity for a show and tell/play with anything that attendees bring. Share your favorite gear, experiment with different setups, and engage in hands-on exploration of various synthesizers and electronic music equipment.
The event unfolds in a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere, providing a platform for musicians, enthusiasts, and curious minds to connect, collaborate, and share their passion for synthesis. Whether you're a beginner seeking guidance or an expert eager to inspire others, Synthesizer Night is the perfect setting to engage in conversations, exchange knowledge, and foster a vibrant community. 
Throughout the evening, you'll have the opportunity to engage in impromptu jam sessions, where the collective energy of multiple synthesizers intertwines to create awe-inspiring sounds. Experience the joy of collaborating with fellow musicians, experiment with different genres and styles, and let the unique characteristics of each instrument shape your sonic explorations.
Additionally, for those who wish to showcase their skills and perform, there will be dedicated performance slots. Take center stage, captivate the audience, and let your creativity soar as you demonstrate the full potential of your synthesizer setup. To sign up for a performance slot, email classes@nycresistor.com or join our Discord and post to #synth.
Whether you're an ardent synth enthusiast, an aspiring musician, or simply curious about the captivating world of synthesizers, Synthesizer Night at NYC Resistor is an event that will inspire, educate, and leave you in awe of the boundless possibilities that electronic sound offers. Don't miss this opportunity to immerse yourself in an evening of music, collaboration, and innovation. Mark your calendars, pack up your favorite synths, and join us at NYC Resistor for a night you won't soon forget. We can't wait to see you there!
This is a masks optional event.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/.

RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/nycresistor-ham-radio-club-tickets-1113096574819

Monthly Amateur Radio club meeting of NYCResistorRadio curious? Join the NYC Resistor Ham Radio Club (call sign N2YCR) for our open and regular meetings, the 4th Wednesday of each month from 8:00 – 9:30 pm at NYC Resistor (87 3rd Avenue, 4th Floor).
The amateur radio hobby has something for everyone, from Morse code to modern digital modes. Bring projects you're working on, gear to fix, problems that puzzle you, outings you'd like to organize, or just yourself to meet & greet your friendly local hams. Drop by the #n2ycr channel in Discord any time to say hi.
You do not need to be a member of Resistor to be a member of the club, nor do you need to be a licensed amateur radio operator (though of course we hope you'll become licensed with our help).
We aim to create an inclusive, encouraging, and diverse environment to bring together Brooklyn's radio hackers, antenna experimenters, shortwave listeners, toroid winders, satellite chasers, and balloon launchers.
Come make some noise in the weird and wonderful medium of radio!This is a masks optional event.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/.
Please note that refunds must be requested 24 hours in advance. If you have any questions, please email classes@nycresistor.com.

events.name: NYC Civic Fair
events.description: ​Looking to get more involved at the local level—but not sure where to start? Join us for a Civic Fair connecting New Yorkers with local organizations tackling the city's biggest challenges—from housing and transportation to elections and streetscapes. Think of it like a career fair, but for community and civic impact. Meet the people doing the work, explore causes you care about, and find the right place to lend your voice, skills, or time.💪​Groups in attendance will include:​Abundance New York​Climate Club Friends​Indivisible BK​Maximum New York​New Kings Democrats​New Liberals​Open New York​Open Plans​Regional Plan Association​Riders Alliance​StreetsPAC​Sunrise Movement NYC​Transportation Alternatives​and more!​​We're asking for a suggested donation of $10 to help supplement the cost of food, snacks, and drinks.​​Venmo: @Len3689CashApp: $LennyAn​About your hosts​NYC June Primary Bootcamp​Along the lines of fitness bootcamps, or career bootcamps, the NYC June Primary Bootcamp is meant to get New Yorkers in shape to not just vote in the primary, but take one more step in their community and political engagement. And make it social so it's more fun! There are different categories of actions that Bootcamp participants can complete, earn points, and win prizes. Here's the full details for the Bootcamp and how to sign up:https://nycpolitics101.substack.com/p/2025bootcamp.​Locally Sourced NYC​Locally Sourced NYC's mission is to show New Yorkers the power of local politics. How does local politics work? Why does it matter? How can you get involved in a way that feels additive to your lifestyle?Follow along on our IG:https://www.instagram.com/locallysourcednycpol/​​Brought to you in partnership with Fabrik!​​​​Fabrikis a home for communities where everyone has a place to belong. With spaces designed to feel more like your living room than your office, Fabrik’s third spaces are vibrant hubs where people can come together in real life, explore interests, forge meaningful connections, and build a sense of community.

events.name: 108th NY Hardware Meetup @ Betaworks | NY Tech Week
events.description: ​​​​The Hardware Meetup community is excited to announce the 108th NY Hardware Meetup at Betaworks!​​​​Hardware Meetupshappen in over 30 cities around the world, bringing together hardware professionals to network and learn from each other.​​​​This month we'll be atBetaworks, the early stage VC and long-time fixture of the NYC tech community. It's a fitting location for our event during NY Tech Week, and we'll be meditating on a fitting topic as well:AI Beyond the Screen.​From robotic systems to intelligent consumer devices, we'll hear about companies working to bring AI into the real world. We're still recruiting presenters and are talking to some incredible companies, but we'd also love to hear fromyou. If you and/or your company are working in robotics, on AI at the edge, or any otherphysicalmanifestation of AI,fill out our speaker formbecause we'd love to feature you at the event. Talks are 10 minutes long,notpitches, and followed by 10 minutes of Q&A.​Even if you don't want to give a full talk, we look forward to hearing from you during the open mic. Bring demos! We're hoping to have some epic hardware in the room.​​SPEAKERS​Follow ourLinkedInpage as we announce them!​Seckin “Sage” Secilmisis the President ofWeb Sensing, a U.S.-based cybersecurity company focused on hardware-based security solutions for critical infrastructure. With over 20 years of experience building products, he has produced mission-critical hardware deployed on land, in the air, in orbit, and even on the Moon.​More soon!​​​AGENDA​​​​6:30 - Arrival, mingle, grab refreshments​​​​7:00 - Welcome and introduction​​7:15- Guest speakers with audience Q+A​​8:20 - Community open mic​​​​Anyone will have the chance or talk about what they are working on.​​8:30 - Mix + mingle​​WANT TO GET INVOLVED?​​​Sponsorship:​We offer exclusive access to our 10,000+ member community through sponsorships.​​​Host an event at your space:We are always looking for host sponsors to provide access to unique spaces from cool hardware companies building interesting things. Want to open up your office?​​​Speaker:Do you have something interesting to share with our community? We're on the lookout for fresh faces to talk about their journey and experiences.​​​If you want to get involved, head here:https://linktr.ee/nyhardware

events.description: ​Join us for unwinding in great company during New York Tech Week! Show up as you are, honore where you are at and mingle with fellow female founders.​AGENDA:​9 - 9:30am: check-in and networking​9:30 - 10am: pitches of Founding Members of La Creme de la STEM™​Abby Rakshit, CEO and Founder atSeason​Yasaman Soroori, CEO and co-founder atConsulta​Holly Diamond, CEO and Founder atWork Onward​Saba Ahmed, co-founder at Tiny Dinner​Jennifer Dwork, co-founder atBummed​Elisabeth Bykoff, CEO and founder atBoxsy​Victoire Mandonnaud, CEO and founder ofOn My Way​Kristin Scholten, Stealth​10 - 10:15am: breath and relax withLizzy Palmer, CEO and co-founder ofSync N​10:15am - 11am: more networking​​ABOUT LA CREME DE LA STEM™:​​​La Creme de la STEM™is the only global, private network for early-stage female founders in tech and science, offering a holistic support system that includes exclusive insights from exited entrepreneurs, vetted investors and perks from corporate partners.Applyto join!​ABOUT CITIZENS​Citizens Private Bankprovides holistic, high-touch client service to startups, venture capital, and private equity firms. 7:00 PM:Welcome ReceptionPremium networking with curated intro connections + CPG brand snacks​7:00 PM - 8:00 PM:Founder-Creator Panel"From Intern to Icon: Building Your Empire Before 25"​Featuring Gen Z founders who:​Turned internships into acquisition offers​Built personal brands with 100K+ engaged followers​Launched companies that VCs actually funded​Created multiple revenue streams before graduation​8:00 PM - 8:30 PM:Empire MixerFinal networking with fellow interns, founders, and industry operators​💎Who Should Attend​✅Summer interns(Tech, Finance, Consulting, Media)✅Aspiring founderswith side projects already in motion✅Content creatorsbuilding their personal brand✅Students/recent gradsinterning in NYC metro area✅Anyone who sees their internship as a stepping stone, not the destination​🏆Featured Panelists​Curating NYC's most impressive Gen Z founder-creators who built empires while their peers were still figuring out their majors.​Panel lineup dropping soon...​🤝Event Partners & Co-Hosts​​The Collective NY: Exclusive community for top young talent, building opportunities for NYC's most ambitious young leaders​​Jonas - Cofounder of The Collective.Connect with him here.​​Maggie - Cofounder of The Collective.Connect with her here.​This event is brought to you by a collective of ambitious operators and founders who believe in elevating the next generation.​Each co-host brings their unique expertise and network to create an unmatched experience for attendees.​📍Venue​Premium Manhattan location(Exact address sent with confirmation)Time:6:30 PM - 8:30 PM ESTDress Code:Come as you are​🎟️Registration​100% FREE- Because we believe in investing in the next generation​Full panel + mixer access​Premium snacks from emerging CPG brands​Limited to 150 attendees - first come, first served​We will personally review and accept the most impressive applications.​💭Why We Are Hosting This​As a group who's built multiple companies and invested in dozens of startups, we see the same pattern: the interns who win big are the ones who think like founders from day one.​They don't just complete assignments—they identify opportunities.They don't just network—they build genuine relationships.They don't just consume content—they create value.​This event is for the 1% of interns who already think this way, and the 10% who are ready to level up.​We covering all costs because we believe the next generation of founders deserves the same opportunities we had—regardless of their bank account.​Your internship is just the beginning. Your empire starts here.​📧Partnership & Sponsorship Inquiries​Interested in partnering with us or sponsoring this exclusive event?Contact:natalie@thegenztea.com​Questions? DM me directly.​Ready to claim your spot in NYC's most exclusive intern experience?

events.name: NYC Tech Week Prayer Walk
events.description: ​NYC Tech Week Prayer Walk​A Event by GenZtea​Join us for a moment of mindfulness before the hustle of NYC Tech Week​Start your NYC Tech Week experience with intention and community. Join fellow tech professionals, entrepreneurs, and innovators for a guided prayer walk along Manhattan's iconic High Line park.​Event Details​Date:Saturday, June 1st, 2025Time:3:00 PM ESTMeeting Point:Shake Shack at Hudson YardsEnd Point:Chelsea Market​What to Expect​Our journey will begin with a group prayer at Hudson Yards, followed by a reflective walk along the elevated High Line park. As we stroll through this urban oasis, we'll have the opportunity to connect, share intentions for the week ahead, and enjoy breathtaking views of the city.​We'll conclude our walk at Chelsea Market with a final prayer of gratitude and intention-setting for NYC Tech Week.​Who This Is For​This event focuses on Christian founders and investors in the tech community, creating space for faith-centered networking and reflection. However, we warmly welcome participants of all backgrounds and beliefs who are interested in starting NYC Tech Week with intentionality and community.​Why Join?​Center yourself before the busy conference schedule​Network with like-minded professionals in a relaxed setting​Experience a unique perspective of NYC​Set meaningful intentions for your Tech Week experience​What to Bring​Comfortable walking shoes​Water bottle​Open mind and heart​This event is open to all, regardless of faith background or tradition. Our focus is on community, mindfulness, and setting positive intentions for the week ahead.​Register now to reserve your spot!​-----------------------------------------------------------------​About the Organizer​GenZteais a community of Gen Z founders, creators,and investors that brings Gen Z not just in the room, but at the table.​Community Partners​Christians in Techwas founded by Andy Choi to create community and support for Christians working in the technology sector. The organization focuses on integrating faith with professional life in the tech industry.​TechWalkwas created by Christine Farrier Rosemin as a platform for meaningful connection in the tech community through guided walks that combine networking with mindfulness and movement.

events.name: DeSciNYC: Genome Editing in Early Human Embryos
events.description: ​Genome editing tools allow the introduction of precise changes in the DNA. For this ability, they became indispensable for basic biological research and hold great promise for future therapeutic applications. The same technologies are being utilized also in early human embryos for better understanding of key developmental regulators and DNA repair mechanisms. In the future, precise correction of specific genes might enable curing devastating diseases early in the development or decreasing the risks of certain diseases. Although continuous research is needed before such an intervention becomes safe, the first gene-edited babies were already born. This talk aims to contribute to the debate about human germline gene editing by putting it into a broader context of human biology, discussing the benefits, current limitations, and possible future alternatives leading to the prevention of genetic diseases.Stepan Jerabek is a postdoctoral research scientist in the Pediatrics Department at Columbia University. He is also an associate scientist at IOCB Prague, an institute of the Czech Academy of Sciences. Stepan’s interest in early development and genome stability brought him to the Egli laboratory, where he uses genome editing tools to study DNA repair in human preimplantation embryos. In 2024, Stepan was the recipient of the Druckenmiller Fellowship Award from the New York Stem Cell Foundation Research Institute. Stepan completed his doctoral training at the Max Planck Institute for Molecular Biomedicine in Germany and was a research fellow at Harvard Medical School, working in the lab of genetics pioneer George Church.🐦Stay Connected about Future Events:Twitter:@descinyc_Instagram:@descinyc​PS: Apply to be a member of the DeSci NYC group chat:https://forms.gle/AmUtotmCgWgGxWDp6

events.name: Startup Friends - Meditative Walk w/ Satori
events.description: ​You survived Tech Week. Panels. Pitches. Pings. Your brain feels like a tab you forgot to close.​If you have to explain what you do one more time, you might explode. So now what?​Zen out or burn out.​The meditative walkis a slow, tech-free walk through Central Park. Phones on airplane mode. No pitches. No pretending to be “on.”​Just actual humans, moving slowly, enjoying nature and breathing like it’s 1996.​Join a crew of ambitious, slightly-fried New Yorkers as we unplug, walk, and remember how to be human again.

Probably still loud applause.​No debate experience needed. Just bring your brain, your sense of humor, and your willingness to argue passionately about things thatmay or may notmatter.
